title: ETL Developer / Data Analyst
description: Location(s)<p><br></p>Alpharetta, Georgia, Birmingham, Alabama, Chicago, Illinois, Dallas, Texas, Downers Grove, Illinois, Jacksonville, Florida, St. Louis, Missouri<p><br></p><strong>Details</strong><p><br></p><em> Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises. </em><p><br></p>Kemper is seeking a candidate with strong Data Analyst and ETL Development skills for the Enterprise Data Services team to assist in data analysis and ETL development. Work with technology and business partners to design, develop, and implement ETL solutions using SQL, IICS and Snowflake. Work with the technical project team to ensure technical requirements are documented, communicated, and implemented.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Data analysis and requirements documentation</li><li>ETL design and development</li><li>Document data mapping</li><li>Research data related inquiries</li><li>Communicate and discuss requirements and data with various project stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working knowledge of SQL (TSQL/PL SQL), ETL patterns and tools and Data Warehouses/ Data Lakes</li><li>3 or more years data analysis or ETL Developer experience</li><li>Experience with databases - Snowflake is required</li><li>Experience with ETL tools - IICS (IDMC) is required</li><li>IT Business/Technical Systems Analyst experience</li><li>Experience with data mapping, modelling, lineage, governance and management a plus</li><li>Effective, clear and concise verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Good organizational and problem-solving skills</li><li>Business Intelligence/Cloud/AWS knowledge or experience preferred</li><li>Education equivalent to a college degree in information technology or technical related discipline, or the equivalent in related work experience</li><li> This position will be located in Jacksonville, FL, Chicago, IL, Alpharetta, GA or Birmingham, AL (Hybrid schedule – one day in the office per week) </li><li>Sponsorship is not offered for this position.</li></ul><p><br></p><em> Kemper is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We are committed to supporting diversity and equality across our organization and we work diligently to maintain a workplace free from discrimination. Kemper is focused on expanding our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion efforts to align with our vision, mission, and guiding principles. Kemper does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Kemper and Kemper will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. </em><p><br></p>Kemper will never request personal information, such as your social security number or banking information, via text or email. Additionally, Kemper does not use external messaging applications like WireApp or Skype to communicate with candidates. If you receive such a message, delete it.<p><br></p>

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Robert Half Technology is searching for a Business Intelligence Analyst. This is a direct-hire opportunity with competitive salary, benefits, and other perks. This position is located in Chicago.<br><br>Business intelligence analysts maintain robust business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, systems and methods. Candidates need a strong background in database technology, ERP systems and processes, with an emphasis on the use of analytical and reporting tools. They work closely with all levels of employees and must have excellent written and oral communication, research, and analytic abilities to convert functional requirements into technical solutions. Expertise in BI, T-SQL, and SQL server, Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) and data cube technology are preferred. Experience in the business intelligence reporting and analytics area.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions</li><li>Providing oversight of project plans, fulfillment of tasks, budgeting, and evaluating training and testing compliance</li><li>Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources</li><li>Assuring the integrity of project data, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis</li><li>Communicating analysis results and making recommendations to senior management<br></li></ul><strong><u>Desired Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with SQL Server</li><li>Experience with BI Tools; PowerBI</li><li>Experience with SSIS, SSRS</li><li>Experience with ETL<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Power BI, Microsoft Power BI, SQL, ETL - Extract Transform Load<br><br>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

title: Data Engineer
description: Job Title: Data Engineer<p><br></p>Salary: $Competitive + excellent benefits (bonus, pension, healthcare, life cover etc.)<p><br></p>Location: Chicago, Washington D.C. New York, or Pennsylvania (US), Hybrid<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Role</u></strong><p><br></p>The Data Engineer is an experienced developer in data engineering and architecture. You will have a focus on data automation and standardization in the service of internal customers such as Data Science and Strategy. You will consistently balance the delivery of client work with the execution of internal data engineering efforts, which create sustainability, innovation and reliability across all clients’ data and analytics needs. This role is a key player in driving forward core components of our data and analytics platform in collaboration with cross-functional stakeholders. You must exhibit strong technical skills and serve as a subject matter expert on data solutions.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Fishawack Health</u></strong><p><br></p>Fishawack Health is the leading global commercialization partner for the modern life science era. Established in 2001 and headquartered in the UK, the organization is powered by a 1,300+ globe-spanning pack of strategic, creative, and scientific experts. We empower healthcare professionals and patients with the knowledge they need to live better lives.<p><br></p>Our core operating units—Medical, Marketing, Market Access, and Consulting—bring together best-in-class capabilities from around the world. We empower our pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical technology clients to navigate the most complex of ecosystems, helping them on an effective path to develop, launch, and grow their brands, services, and portfolios.<p><br></p>Our internationally recognized, award-winning teams collaborate across operations in the UK (Brighton, Fleet, London, Knutsford, Manchester, Oxford, and Sale), Ireland (Dublin), USA (Chicago, Evansville, Minneapolis, New York, Philadelphia, San Diego, Scottsdale, and St. Louis), Greece (Athens), and Singapore.<p><br></p>What you’ll do<p><br></p><ul><li>Executes the design and implementation of various data architecture layers including ingestion, cleansing, unification, and consumption in order to meet the needs of our customers </li><li>Collaborates with cross-functional stakeholders such as Data Scientists, Business Analysts, Project Managers, Media Operations and Quality Assurance to achieve expected results </li><li>Builds, maintains, and distributes technical documentation across all data engineering work </li><li>Proactively identifies and capitalizes on opportunities for efficiency, sustainability, innovation, and standardization through efforts such as data consolidation and automation </li><li>Keeps up to date with the latest trends in data engineering and takes lead on leveraging new technologies and innovations relevant to the business </li><li>Oversees and participates in day-to-day engineering tasks, break/fix routines and code reviews </li><li>Understands and complies with compliance and security standards such as HIPAA, GDPR and CCPA </li><li>Identifies risks with solutions while developing, proposing and implementing mitigation plans </li><li>Works closely with Quality Assurance on data quality, relevant training, test cases and planning</li></ul><p><br></p>About you <ul><li>4 years of experience in data engineering with strong emphasis on complex SQL and DB design </li><li>2 years of experience developing highly custom, automated ETL procedures and data pipelines </li><li>2 years of experience building, designing, and architecting data solutions in support of advanced analytics, complex algorithms, and sophisticated data science modeling work </li><li>Proficient with GCP (Google Cloud Platform), BigQuery, Postgres and data pipeline tools </li><li>Proficient with Git version control systems and release/change management processes </li><li>Proficient data warehousing, performance turning, data security, auditing and encryption </li><li>Proficient translating high-level business requirements into data solutions </li><li>Proficient with the full software development lifecycle from inception to deployment </li><li>Excellent written and verbal communicator particularly with non-technical stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications: <ul><li>BS/BA degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, or related field </li><li>Experience working at a healthcare agency in a hybrid agile/waterfall environment </li><li>Cloud engineering experience including infrastructure maintenance and IAM </li><li>Experience with marketing analytics tools such as GA, GCM, and Facebook Ads </li><li>Experience leveraging continuous integration methods </li><li>Experience with HIPAA compliance and related security measures </li><li>Experience programming with object-oriented methodologies </li><li>Experience with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li></ul><p><br></p>What we can offer<p><br></p>We offer a creative, supportive environment with a uniquely diverse career structure, where you will be able to develop and tailor your career towards your preferred route. Our Fuel50 talent experience platform will enable you to pick and map a career journey across the organisation, providing you with the option to progress within different areas of your team or beyond. Our Pack Academy provides a broad range of training delivered live and on-demand, which supplements on-the-job training and project team-led initiatives. We also offer a generous company pension, private medical insurance, various employee wellbeing initiatives, plus many other excellent employee benefits.<p><br></p>Reasonable adjustments<p><br></p>Fishawack Health is an equal opportunities employer and place where everyone is welcome. We believe success lies in our differences and only by embracing these differences can we build a healthier world together. We strongly encourage people from minority backgrounds, LGBTQIA+, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know. In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).<p><br></p>We encourage all applicants to read our company Privacy Policy (http://fishawack.com/privacy-policy) before applying to a role. <p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

written and verbal communicator particularly with non-technical stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications: <ul><li>BS/BA degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, or related field </li><li>Experience working at a healthcare agency in a hybrid agile/waterfall environment </li><li>Cloud engineering experience including infrastructure maintenance and IAM </li><li>Experience with marketing analytics tools such as GA, GCM, and Facebook Ads </li><li>Experience leveraging continuous integration methods </li><li>Experience with HIPAA compliance and related security measures </li><li>Experience programming with object-oriented methodologies </li><li>Experience with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li></ul><p><br></p>What we can offer<p><br></p>We offer a creative, supportive environment with a uniquely diverse career structure, where you will be able to develop and tailor your career towards your preferred route. Our Fuel50 talent experience platform will enable you to pick and map a career journey across the organisation, providing you with the option to progress within different areas of your team or beyond. Our Pack Academy provides a broad range of training delivered live and on-demand, which supplements on-the-job training and project team-led initiatives. We also offer a generous company pension, private medical insurance, various employee wellbeing initiatives, plus many other excellent employee benefits.<p><br></p>Reasonable adjustments<p><br></p>Fishawack Health is an equal opportunities employer and place where everyone is welcome. We strongly encourage people from minority backgrounds, LGBTQIA+, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. title: HR Reporting & Data Integration Analyst
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>In this role, you will join a fast-paced Human Resources analytics team as an HR Reporting &amp; Data Integration Analyst and serve as the Workday HCM data and reporting subject matter expert. This experienced candidate will have strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies. You will be an expert in building and maintaining complex calculated fields and have a solid understanding of the relationships within Workday’s Business Objects. In addition, this role will also support other areas of HR reporting including Tableau developed reports and dashboards from a data quality perspective, as well as data migration and transformation into our cloud environment. This role will be a liaison to Business Technology to support new and existing data from Workday to our data warehouse for continued use in advanced reporting and analytics development. As a Lead Reporting &amp; Analytics Developer, you will also be responsible for understanding and supporting data stewardship initiatives and the importance of security for all HR data the team manages. A successful team member will be extremely detail orientated, flexible with continuous process / system changes and comprehend the abilities and limitations from a reporting perspective.<p><br></p>Responsible for creating reporting solutions and partnering with technology teams to manage Human Resources data and reporting technologies. Designs and develops analyses on the employee population, including demographic profiles, turnover ratios, activity reports, and recruitment data. Partners with internal clients to address reporting needs. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creates report solutions</li><li>Consults with internal clients on the development of analytics including: needs assessments, programming, and delivery of report solutions.</li><li>Identifies, troubleshoots, and validates data discrepancies between data sources. Provides solutions to improve accuracy and usability of data.</li><li>Develops self service tools that enable users to interact with data sets, process data, and generate reports.</li><li>Utilizes tools and automation to satisfy key compliance data requirements.</li><li>Manages HR data warehouse architecture in partnership with technology team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Analytics, Statistics or related field </li><li>2+ years of experience in Reporting, analytics, relational and multi-dimensional databases, report writing software, internal client requirements, developing data-driven solutions, report building, HRIS systems or related</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in HR Analytics and reporting </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior HR experience in a data/analytics/reporting role</li><li>Previous Snowflake or similar data warehouse experience </li><li>Workday Report Writer experience</li><li>An understanding of data stewardship and security for all HR data the team manages</li><li>Strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>
description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>In this role, you will join a fast-paced Human Resources analytics team as an HR Reporting &amp; Data Integration Analyst and serve as the Workday HCM data and reporting subject matter expert. This experienced candidate will have strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies. You will be an expert in building and maintaining complex calculated fields and have a solid understanding of the relationships within Workday’s Business Objects. In addition, this role will also support other areas of HR reporting including Tableau developed reports and dashboards from a data quality perspective, as well as data migration and transformation into our cloud environment. This role will be a liaison to Business Technology to support new and existing data from Workday to our data warehouse for continued use in advanced reporting and analytics development. As a Lead Reporting &amp; Analytics Developer, you will also be responsible for understanding and supporting data stewardship initiatives and the importance of security for all HR data the team manages. A successful team member will be extremely detail orientated, flexible with continuous process / system changes and comprehend the abilities and limitations from a reporting perspective.<p><br></p>Responsible for creating reporting solutions and partnering with technology teams to manage Human Resources data and reporting technologies. Partners with internal clients to address reporting needs. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creates report solutions</li><li>Consults with internal clients on the development of analytics including: needs assessments, programming, and delivery of report solutions.</li><li>Identifies, troubleshoots, and validates data discrepancies between data sources. Provides solutions to improve accuracy and usability of data.</li><li>Develops self service tools that enable users to interact with data sets, process data, and generate reports.</li><li>Utilizes tools and automation to satisfy key compliance data requirements.</li><li>Manages HR data warehouse architecture in partnership with technology team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Analytics, Statistics or related field </li><li>2+ years of experience in Reporting, analytics, relational and multi-dimensional databases, report writing software, internal client requirements, developing data-driven solutions, report building, HRIS systems or related</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in HR Analytics and reporting </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior HR experience in a data/analytics/reporting role</li><li>Previous Snowflake or similar data warehouse experience </li><li>Workday Report Writer experience</li><li>An understanding of data stewardship and security for all HR data the team manages</li><li>Strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. title: Assort Analyst
description: <p>JOB OBJECTIVE</p><p>The Category Assort Analyst (CSA) is responsible to work within the I2E Platform to optimize assortment and collaborate with stakeholders. Position will remain focused on schematic assortment specific to the category they are working on to ensure assortment is aligned National Category Directors and Manufacturers goals and objectives. CSA will be responsible to collaborate with schematic analyst team to support maintenance of product assortment through software programs for selected categories.</p><p><br></p><p>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS</p><ul><li>Responsible for achieving deliverables according to timelines for Assortment creation.</li><li>Assist Category Assort Lead in tailoring Division Assortment specific to each market, accommodating regional/local items while following National guardrails.</li><li>Customize Division Assortments down to cluster and/or set size level.</li><li>Collaborate and review Division Assortments with local ASM’s.</li><li>Assist Category Assort Lead in understanding store space limitations at the shelf and develop innovative solutions to meet the companies’ objectives.</li><li>Responsible for reporting data errors to the appropriate party for resolution.</li><li>Provide Assortment analytics to supporting departments (NCD’s, CATaylst, OWN Brands, Schematics).</li><li>Work with Schematic Analyst I in verifying all items are in the set room as well as set up/take down (when applicable).</li><li>Responsible for ensuring that all items are scanned through Syndigo.</li></ul><p>QUALIFICATIONS</p><ul><li>BA/BS degree preferred or equivalent experience.</li><li>Non-perishable/perishable product knowledge and merchandising background preferred.</li><li>Strong PC skills (preferred Microsoft Office knowledge) Working knowledge of internal Albertsons systems a plus.</li><li>Strong analytical skills with the ability to solve business problems.</li><li>Team oriented with excellent time management and organization skills.</li><li>Excellent communication skills (both verbal &amp; written)</li><li>Customer service oriented with ability to maintain positive attitude in all situations.</li><li>Must possess and demonstrate a strong sense of urgency, energy, and be very detail oriented.</li><li>Sterling integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality.</li><li>Ability to view the changing dynamics of the grocery industry and seek out opportunities for synergy and integration within different areas of the business.</li><li>Able to effectively cope with change.</li></ul><p></p>

title: Junior Data Scientist (Remote)
description: SYNERGISTICIT is aware that the Job Market is Challenging because of Tech Layoffs. The Job market is flooded with hundreds and thousands of laid-off Jobseekers competing with existing Jobseekers. For entry-level Job seekers to get client interviews and jobs they need to differentiate themselves by ensuring they have exceptional skills and technologies to be noticed by clients.<p><br></p>Since 2010 we have helped Jobseekers differentiate themselves by providing clients with candidates who have the requisite skills and experience to outperform at interviews and clients. Here at SynergisticIT We just don't focus on getting you a Job we make careers. All Positions are open for all visas and US citizens We at Synergisticit understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped thousands of candidates get jobs at technology clients like Apple, Google, and Paypal, western union, Client, visa, Walmart labs, etc., to name a few. We have an excellent reputation with the clients. Currently, we are looking for Junior Data Scientist(Remote)<p><br></p>Who Should Apply Recent Computer Science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates looking to make their careers in IT Industry We welcome candidates with all visas and citizens to apply. We assist in filing for STEM extension and also for H1b and Green card filing to Candidates<p><br></p>We also offer Skill enhancement programs for candidates who are either missing skills or lacking Industry/Client experience with Projects and skills. Candidates have difficulty finding jobs or cracking interviews or want to improve their skill portfolio. If they are qualified with enough skills and have hands-on project work with clients then no need for skill enhancement.<p><br></p>Candidates can benefit from skill enhancement if they fall into the below categories.<p><br></p>Candidates who Lack Experience or are fresher with No actual Job experience with projects with clients who Have had a break in careers Lack Technical Competency or skills being demanded by clients Different visa candidates (Like OPT/H4EAD/L2EAD) who want to get employed and settle down in the USA please check the below links to see success outcomes of our candidates https://www.synergisticit.com/candidate-outcomes/<p><br></p>Watch the below videos of us participating in Industry events with the Top companies in Technology at Oracle Cloud World/Oracle Java One (Las Vegas) and at Gartner Data Analytics Summit (Florida)<p><br></p>Oracle Cloud World Event (OCW) Las Vegas 2022 | SynergisticIT - YouTube https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OAFOhcGy9Z8<p><br></p>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EmO7NrWHkLM https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVBU9RYZ6UI<p><br></p>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yy74yvjatVg SynergisticIT at Gartner Data and Analytics Summit 2023 - YouTube<p><br></p>https://www.synergisticit.com/java-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/data-science-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/contact-us/<p><br></p>If you have relevant skills and industry experience, please apply if not then candidates can opt for Skill enhancement.<p><br></p>For getting help with interviews please visit<p><br></p>https://www.synergisticit.com/interview-questions/<p><br></p><strong><u>REQUIRED SKILLS For Java /Software Programmers</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT</li><li> Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive</li><li> Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle</li><li> Project work on the skills</li><li> Knowledge of Core Java, java script, C++ or software programming</li><li> Spring boot, Micro-services, Docker, Jenkins and REST API's experience</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>For data Science/Machine learning<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT</li><li> Project work on the technologies needed</li><li> Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive</li><li> Experience in the programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle</li><li> Knowledge of Statistics, SAS, Python, Computer Vision, and data visualization tools</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred skills: NLP, Text mining, Tableau, Power BI, Time series analysis<p><br></p>Please understand skills and relevant experience on real-world projects are required by clients for selection even if it's a Junior or entry-level position the additional skills and Project work with hands-on experience building projects at the client site are the only way a candidate can be picked by clients. If not having the skills or hands-on project work at the client site, candidates can opt for skill enhancement to gain the required skills and project work. No third-party candidates or c2c candidates<p><br></p>please only apply to the posting<p><br></p>No phone calls, please. Shortlisted candidates would be reached out to.

title: IT Technical Associate (Business & Diagnostic Systems Analyst)
description: <strong>Business and Diagnostic Systems Analyst</strong><p><br></p><strong>Hiring Department</strong>: Information Services<p><br></p><strong>Location</strong>: Chicago, IL USA<p><br></p><strong>Requisition ID</strong>: 1016977<p><br></p><strong>Posting Close Date</strong>: 7/9/2023<p><br></p><strong>About UI Health</strong><p><br></p>The University of Illinois Hospital &amp; Health Sciences System (UI Health) provides comprehensive care, education, and research to the people of Illinois and beyond. A part of the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), UI Health comprises a clinical enterprise that includes a 495-bed tertiary care hospital, 22 outpatient clinics, and 13 Mile Square Health Center facilities, which are Federally Qualified Health Centers. It also includes the seven UIC health science colleges: the College of Applied Health Sciences; the College of Dentistry; the School of Public Health; the Jane Addams College of Social Work; and the Colleges of Medicine, Pharmacy, and Nursing, including regional campuses in Peoria, Quad Cities, Rockford, Springfield, and Urbana. UI Health is dedicated to the pursuit of health equity.<p><br></p><strong>Description:</strong><p><br></p>Under general direction and as part of a collaborative team, implements, configures, supports, and manages healthcare software applications, which includes Electronic Health Record systems, specifically Business &amp; Diagnostic applications and integrating systems. Provides production application support on a rotating 24/7 basis.<p><br></p><strong>Duties &amp; Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>As part of the Business &amp; Diagnostic Systems team, work in collaboration with vendor representatives and the UI Health clinical and business community to ensure the EHR systems meet the organization’s clinical and business needs.</li><li>Gather information from clinicians and staff regarding clinical and operational workflows and business goals and risks to define new healthcare application requirements.</li><li>Recommend innovative application solutions to clinical workflow, patient safety, productivity, and financial problems. Assist application teams in development of design and required documentation. Analyze business processes and reengineers those processes to improve business and/or clinical needs.</li><li>Plan, perform, and test regular software upgrades/updates.</li><li>Review and test each new release, ensuring adherence to the testing policies and procedures for application team members. Develop and follow plans to collect information regarding potential system enhancement needs and coordinates preparation of specifications as needed.</li><li>Support other affected applications as appropriate. This includes communication and coordination with other vendors and/or Information Services staff related to 3rd party applications which may interact or interface with Epic.</li><li>Participate in the design of new tools, components, functionalities within healthcare applications. Implement software modifications and document changes to designs, tools, components, functionalities and processes.</li><li>Test software modifications or enhancements in a test environment. Ensure integration of healthcare application data and information across platforms and systems.</li><li>Meet with end users to determine and define report requirements and ensure delivered reports/data meet quality standards.</li><li>Identify improvements and suggest changes to new policies, procedures, or work practices.</li><li>Engage with vendors and maintain vendor relationships. Participate in analysis of vendor solutions and enforce vendor service level agreements (SLA). Contact vendor to resolve issues.</li><li>Assist in development of specifications and standards to ensure adherence to regulatory, medical, campus and university standards.</li><li>Provide application support on a rotating 24/7 basis.</li><li>Successfully complete manager identified, required system training and certifications needed to support assigned applications within communicated timeframes.</li><li>Perform other related duties and participate in special projects as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor Degree - Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems Management, related information management field or a clinical area of study. </li><li>Minimum of one (1) year professional level IT experience within Software Solutions which includes demonstrated experience in designing, implementing, maintaining, and managing healthcare information systems (e.g., Epic, PACS, billing, supply chain, utilization review, operating rooms, scheduling, diagnostic imaging, pathology, etc) to effectively apply information technology solutions to improve healthcare operations; ensure effective integration of clinical and revenue cycle systems with other institutional applications.</li><li>Demonstrated experience of system build/configuration of software applications.</li></ul><p><br></p>This position requires Illinois residency within 180 days of the hire date<p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems Management, related information management field, or a clinical area of study. </li><li>Minimum 1 year professional IT or clinical experience within the designated discipline. </li><li>Working knowledge of build tools in healthcare software applications which may include electronic health records applications, such as Epic. </li><li>Knowledge of system management principles, application development, and application testing strategies. </li><li> Strong analytical, interpersonal, and communications skills. </li><li>Demonstrated ability to multi-task, meet commitments, and balance work demands.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Fully complete all sections of the online application including adding your full work history with specific details of your duties &amp; responsibilities for each position held. Fully complete the education, licensure, certification, and language sections.</strong><p><br></p>You may upload a resume, cover letter, certifications, licensures, transcripts, and diplomas within the document section of your online application.<p><br></p>All civil service positions require an exam. The exam for this position is a Credentials Assessment. You will not be required to report in person for this exam.<p><br></p><strong> Credential Assessment Exam Scoring Information </strong><p><br></p>You will not be required to report in person for this exam. The updated online application and all uploaded, relevant documents, such as a resume, college transcript, certifications and licensures will be used in the calculation of the exam score. These documents should be uploaded prior to the position close date.<p><br></p><strong>When completing your online application, please be sure to provide detailed information about your job knowledge and specific duties and responsibilities, as your qualifications for any Civil Service position will be primarily determined based on what is contained in the application. Dates of employment and if employed on a full or part time basis (including number of hours per week) must be indicated for each position held. Additional consideration will be given to supporting documentation i.e., resume, transcripts, licenses, and certifications so please be sure to attach all applicable documents.</strong><p><br></p>If an application is not fully completed and submitted by the close date, the applicant/employee will not be considered for this position.<p><br></p>For fullest consideration, the above-mentioned requirements must be submitted no later than <strong>7/9/2023.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Please note that once you have submitted your application you will not be able to make any changes. In order to revise your application, you must withdraw and reapply. You will not be able to reapply after the posting close date. Please ensure the application is fully completed and all supporting documents have been uploaded before the posting close date.</strong><p><br></p>The University of Illinois System is an equal opportunity employer, including but not limited to disability and/or veteran status, and complies with all applicable state and federal employment mandates. Please visit Required Employment Notices and Posters to view our non-discrimination statement and find additional information about required background checks, sexual harassment/misconduct disclosures, COVID-19 vaccination requirement, and employment eligibility review through E-Verify.<p><br></p>The university provides accommodations to applicants and employees. Request an Accommodation
description_json: <strong>Business and Diagnostic Systems Analyst</strong><p><br></p><strong>Hiring Department</strong>: Information Services<p><br></p><strong>Location</strong>: Chicago, IL USA<p><br></p><strong>Requisition ID</strong>: 1016977<p><br></p><strong>Posting Close Date</strong>: 7/9/2023<p><br></p><strong>About UI Health</strong><p><br></p>The University of Illinois Hospital &amp; Health Sciences System (UI Health) provides comprehensive care, education, and research to the people of Illinois and beyond. A part of the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), UI Health comprises a clinical enterprise that includes a 495-bed tertiary care hospital, 22 outpatient clinics, and 13 Mile Square Health Center facilities, which are Federally Qualified Health Centers. It also includes the seven UIC health science colleges: the College of Applied Health Sciences; the College of Dentistry; the School of Public Health; the Jane Addams College of Social Work; and the Colleges of Medicine, Pharmacy, and Nursing, including regional campuses in Peoria, Quad Cities, Rockford, Springfield, and Urbana. UI Health is dedicated to the pursuit of health equity.<p><br></p><strong>Description:</strong><p><br></p>Under general direction and as part of a collaborative team, implements, configures, supports, and manages healthcare software applications, which includes Electronic Health Record systems, specifically Business &amp; Diagnostic applications and integrating systems. Provides production application support on a rotating 24/7 basis.<p><br></p><strong>Duties &amp; Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>As part of the Business &amp; Diagnostic Systems team, work in collaboration with vendor representatives and the UI Health clinical and business community to ensure the EHR systems meet the organization’s clinical and business needs.</li><li>Gather information from clinicians and staff regarding clinical and operational workflows and business goals and risks to define new healthcare application requirements.</li><li>Recommend innovative application solutions to clinical workflow, patient safety, productivity, and financial problems. Assist application teams in development of design and required documentation. Analyze business processes and reengineers those processes to improve business and/or clinical needs.</li><li>Plan, perform, and test regular software upgrades/updates.</li><li>Review and test each new release, ensuring adherence to the testing policies and procedures for application team members. Develop and follow plans to collect information regarding potential system enhancement needs and coordinates preparation of specifications as needed.</li><li>Support other affected applications as appropriate. This includes communication and coordination with other vendors and/or Information Services staff related to 3rd party applications which may interact or interface with Epic.</li><li>Participate in the design of new tools, components, functionalities within healthcare applications. Implement software modifications and document changes to designs, tools, components, functionalities and processes.</li><li>Test software modifications or enhancements in a test environment. Ensure integration of healthcare application data and information across platforms and systems.</li><li>Meet with end users to determine and define report requirements and ensure delivered reports/data meet quality standards.</li><li>Identify improvements and suggest changes to new policies, procedures, or work practices.</li><li>Engage with vendors and maintain vendor relationships. Participate in analysis of vendor solutions and enforce vendor service level agreements (SLA). Contact vendor to resolve issues.</li><li>Assist in development of specifications and standards to ensure adherence to regulatory, medical, campus and university standards.</li><li>Provide application support on a rotating 24/7 basis.</li><li>Successfully complete manager identified, required system training and certifications needed to support assigned applications within communicated timeframes.</li><li>Perform other related duties and participate in special projects as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor Degree - Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems Management, related information management field or a clinical area of study. </li><li>Minimum of one (1) year professional level IT experience within Software Solutions which includes demonstrated experience in designing, implementing, maintaining, and managing healthcare information systems (e.g., Epic, PACS, billing, supply chain, utilization review, operating rooms, scheduling, diagnostic imaging, pathology, etc) to effectively apply information technology solutions to improve healthcare operations; ensure effective integration of clinical and revenue cycle systems with other institutional applications.</li><li>Demonstrated experience of system build/configuration of software applications.</li></ul><p><br></p>This position requires Illinois residency within 180 days of the hire date<p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems Management, related information management field, or a clinical area of study. </li><li>Minimum 1 year professional IT or clinical experience within the designated discipline. </li><li>Working knowledge of build tools in healthcare software applications which may include electronic health records applications, such as Epic. </li><li>Knowledge of system management principles, application development, and application testing strategies. </li><li> Strong analytical, interpersonal, and communications skills. </li><li>Demonstrated ability to multi-task, meet commitments, and balance work demands.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Fully complete all sections of the online application including adding your full work history with specific details of your duties &amp; responsibilities for each position held. Fully complete the education, licensure, certification, and language sections.</strong><p><br></p>You may upload a resume, cover letter, certifications, licensures, transcripts, and diplomas within the document section of your online application.<p><br></p>All civil service positions require an exam. The exam for this position is a Credentials Assessment. You will not be required to report in person for this exam.<p><br></p><strong> Credential Assessment Exam Scoring Information </strong><p><br></p>You will not be required to report in person for this exam. The updated online application and all uploaded, relevant documents, such as a resume, college transcript, certifications and licensures will be used in the calculation of the exam score. These documents should be uploaded prior to the position close date.<p><br></p><strong>When completing your online application, please be sure to provide detailed information about your job knowledge and specific duties and responsibilities, as your qualifications for any Civil Service position will be primarily determined based on what is contained in the application. Dates of employment and if employed on a full or part time basis (including number of hours per week) must be indicated for each position held. Additional consideration will be given to supporting documentation i.e., resume, transcripts, licenses, and certifications so please be sure to attach all applicable documents.</strong><p><br></p>If an application is not fully completed and submitted by the close date, the applicant/employee will not be considered for this position.<p><br></p>For fullest consideration, the above-mentioned requirements must be submitted no later than <strong>7/9/2023.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Please note that once you have submitted your application you will not be able to make any changes. In order to revise your application, you must withdraw and reapply. You will not be able to reapply after the posting close date. Please ensure the application is fully completed and all supporting documents have been uploaded before the posting close date.</strong><p><br></p>The University of Illinois System is an equal opportunity employer, including but not limited to disability and/or veteran status, and complies with all applicable state and federal employment mandates. Please visit Required Employment Notices and Posters to view our non-discrimination statement and find additional information about required background checks, sexual harassment/misconduct disclosures, COVID-19 vaccination requirement, and employment eligibility review through E-Verify.<p><br></p>The university provides accommodations to applicants and employees. Request an Accommodation

title: Data Scientist - Materials Discovery Research Institute
description: The Materials Discovery Research Institute (MDRI) a UL Research Institute (ULRI) is seeking an exceptionally talented Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data science, machine learning, and advanced analytics. They will be responsible for developing innovative solutions to complex scientific problems, leveraging cutting-edge methodologies and tools. This position offers an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.<p><br></p>The MDRI was launched in September 2022, with a focus of bringing the Materials Discovery process into the 21st century. The MDRI represents a state-of-the-art research institute, pushing the boundaries of material discovery with targeted applications in global sustainability concerns and individual and societal health, using modern computational chemistry to enable the targeted synthesis of materials leveraging high throughput rob synthesis and characterization solutions. The MDRI will seek to combine modern laboratory information management systems (LIMS) with electronic laboratory notebooks (ELNs) providing a holistic data infrastructure<p><br></p>The Data Scientist will use advanced mathematical and statistical concepts and theories to collect and analyze data and construct solutions to complex research and stakeholder problems for the MDRI, including advanced statistical analysis on experimental or organizational data to identify, validate and quantify trends or patterns based on guidance from research leaders. Construct advanced predictive models, algorithms, and probability engines to support data analysis or material properties; verifies model and algorithm effectiveness based on real-world results. Designs experiments and methodologies to generate and collect data for organizational use.<p><br></p>The Data Scientist will work in close contact with materials scientist and engineers providing a flexible-friendly use digital tools for data handling/analysis.<p><br></p><em><strong>UL has COVID-19 protocols and policies in place to ensure the safety of our employees, customers and clients. Effective November 1, 2021, the company mandates that employees are vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment (except where prohibited by law), subject to reasonable accommodation as required by law. </strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop advanced machine learning models and statistical algorithms to discover insights, trends, and patterns in large, complex datasets.</li><li>Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams from within and outside of the institute, including data engineers, software developers, and business stakeholders, to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables.</li><li>Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines, from data acquisition and preprocessing to model training, evaluation, and deployment.</li><li>Conduct thorough and rigorous validation of models to ensure their accuracy, reliability, and robustness.</li><li>Continuously explore, evaluate, and integrate new data sources and cutting-edge technologies to enhance our analytics capabilities.</li><li>Effectively communicate complex technical concepts, methodologies, and results to diverse audiences, including senior management, amplifications partners, and team members.</li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, and contribute to the development of new methodologies and best practices.</li><li>Contribute to the establishment and maintenance of data governance and quality standards within the organization.</li><li>Contribute towards the publication of research papers, technical reports, and patent applications, representing the company in the scientific community and at industry events.</li><li> Implement and maintain a digital lab notebook for MDRI for diverse types of chemical and material synthesis approaches by means of RDM software.</li><li>Create and maintain a digital database record for all relevant characterization information obtained for the different products obtained in MDRI.</li><li>Assist research leaders with the definition and development of user-friendly reports and graphics that integrate and convey complex data/information.</li><li>Perform other duties as directed.</li><li>Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms, statistical modeling techniques, and data mining methods.</li><li>Ability to develop solutions to loosely defined research problems by leveraging pattern detection over large data sets.</li><li>Excellent time and project management skills</li><li>Exceptional problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills, with the ability to adapt to new challenges quickly.</li><li>Willingness to learn and research new concepts and technologies in quick Proof of Concepts</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with technical and nontechnical internal and external stakeholders.</li><li>Ability to organize, analyze and correlate data information including skills in dashboarding.</li><li>Skilled in versioning best practices, i.e. GitHub, Gitlab, Code Commit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience And Education Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelor’s degree) in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science or a related discipline.</li><li>Minimum 3 years of experience in statistical analysis or data science.</li><li>Solid technical knowledge and experience working with R, SAS, Java or Python programming language.</li><li>Mission For Underwriters Laboratories, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 127 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.</li><li>People Ask any Underwriters Laboratories employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at Underwriters Laboratories. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best.</li><li>Interesting work Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.</li><li>Grow &amp; achieve We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles.</li><li>Total Rewards All employees at Underwriters Laboratories are eligible for bonus compensation. Underwriters Laboratories offers a generous 401k matching structure of up to 5% of eligible pay. Additionally, we invest an additional 4% into your retirement saving fund after your first year of continuous employment. We provide Healthcare Reimbursement Accounts and Health Savings Accounts that Underwriters Laboratories contributes to twice per year! Depending on your role, you can work with your manager on flexible working arrangements. We also provide employees with paid time off including vacation, holiday, sick and volunteer time off.</li></ul><p><br></p>Underwriters Laboratories Inc. is a nonprofit organization dedicated to advancing safety science research through the discovery and application of scientific knowledge. We conduct rigorous independent research and analyze safety data, convene experts worldwide to address risks, share knowledge through safety education and public outreach initiatives, and develop standards to guide safe commercialization of evolving technologies. We foster communities of safety, from grassroots initiatives for neighborhoods to summits of world leaders. Our organization employs collaborative and scientific approaches with partners and stakeholders to drive innovation and progress toward improving safety, security, and sustainability, ultimately enhancing societal well-being.<p><br></p>Our wholly owned subsidiary, UL Inc., advances our shared public safety mission. We fund our work through grants, the licensing of standards documents and the business activities of UL Inc., which conducts testing, verification and certification, and provides training and advisory services, along with data-driven reporting and decision-making tools for customers around the world.<p><br></p>To learn more, visit UL.org.

title: Data Engineer (Remote)
description: <strong>This is a fully remote position. </strong><p><br></p><strong>Work on things that matter</strong><p><br></p>Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our teams use modern, agile methods to design and engineer government systems that connect Veterans with services, bring affordable health care to millions of people, and support important programs like Head Start. And as we work to make critical government services intuitive, accessible, and human-centered, we’re also changing how the government thinks about and uses technology. If you thrive on change, want to help close the gap between consumer expectations and government services, and can see the possibilities in ambiguity, then we want you here with us.<p><br></p><strong><u>What Matters Most</u></strong><p><br></p>Ad Hoc operates according to our commitment to inclusivity, acceptance, accountability, and humility. We aren’t heroes. We believe in missions larger than our individual selves and leave our egos at the door, learn from our mistakes, and iterate in order to better serve the people in our country. We prioritize building teams that represent the diversity of the people our government serves. We love the challenge of government-size projects. We want to bring skills to federal agencies, help them better meet the needs of their users, and close the gap between consumer expectations and government.<p><br></p><strong>Built for a remote life</strong><p><br></p>Ad Hoc is remote-first and remote-always. We’ve designed our culture, communications, and tools to support a nationwide distributed team since the beginning. Being remote by design allows Ad Hoc to be thoughtful and intentional about creating diverse teams and supporting them with a work environment that fits their lives. With a generous PTO policy and Slack channels for every interest (from bird watching to space nerds to parenting) our culture embraces the things happening in your life. Maybe you need to adjust your schedule to care for your family or take a bike ride. At Ad Hoc, that’s embraced.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Do</u></strong><p><br></p>Data Engineers are responsible for working with the systems and infrastructure that enable data storage, processing, and analysis. They work closely with data scientists and analysts to ensure that data is properly collected, organized, enriched, refined, and available for analysis. They are the critical connectors between the teams that maintain existing legacy systems, and the data analysts and data scientists that will use aggregated data for analysis, reporting, and predictive analytics.<p><br></p><ul><li>Shipping software that impacts the lives of millions of people</li><li>Using modern programming languages and frameworks to build scalable services that gracefully integrate with legacy systems</li><li>Building and working with APIs to support both the digital services we deliver as well as third-party usage</li><li>Helping us continuously, iteratively improve</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Hope You'll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A minimum of four (4) years of professional software development experience</li><li>AWS experience</li><li>Understanding of ETL/ELT processes and tooling</li><li>Understanding of database technologies - setup/ maintenance / data loads / etc. (not data modeling)</li><li>Redshift experience preferred</li><li>Understand system security</li><li>API design and implementation</li><li>GIT and DevOps release process</li><li>Python or Scala, Python is preferred for ETL</li><li>Some experience with older file systems / file based processes such as MOVEit</li><li>Some experience with Mulesoft</li><li>Experience with agile software development practices emphasizing agility, flexibility, and iterative development</li></ul><p><br></p>More than that, our ideal candidate wants to contribute to work that is bigger than themselves and wants to make a difference collaborating with their team. They care deeply about building better products, better relationships, and better trust in each interaction people have with their government. They believe in intuitive, easy-to-use government services. They collaborate well with designers, stakeholders, and other teams. They mentor and guide more junior engineers. They’re human-centered.<p><br></p>And if you don’t check every box on the list? That doesn’t mean you can’t help us in our mission to deliver critical government services. Talk to us!<p><br></p><strong><u>Some Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>All work must be conducted within the U.S., excluding U.S. territories. Some federal contracts require U.S. citizenship to be eligible for employment.</li><li>You must be legally authorized to work in the U.S now and in the future without sponsorship.</li><li>As a government contractor, you may be required to obtain a public trust security clearance.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in a technical field is preferred</li><li>4 years of professional software development</li><li>Our technical screening involves completing a homework assignment that is then graded blind to remove bias. We do not do tricky, unreliable whiteboarding tests. You can read more about our homework here.</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more about engineering at Ad Hoc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Company-subsidized Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance</li><li>Use What You Need Vacation Policy</li><li>401K with employer match</li><li>Paid parental leave after one year of service</li></ul><p><br></p>Ad Hoc LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, pregnancy, disability, work-related injury, covered veteran status, political ideology, marital status, or any other factor that the law protects from employment discrimination.<p><br></p>In support of the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, and others like it across the country, Ad Hoc job descriptions feature the starting range we reasonably expect to pay to candidates who would join our team with little to no need for training on the responsibilities we've outlined above. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide range of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and responsibility. The range of starting pay for this role is $101,570 - $136,994 and information on benefits offered is here. Our recruiters will be happy to answer any questions you may have, and we look forward to learning more about your salary requirements.<p><br></p>job reference: 2015

We do not do tricky, unreliable whiteboarding tests. You can read more about our homework here.</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more about engineering at Ad Hoc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Company-subsidized Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance</li><li>Use What You Need Vacation Policy</li><li>401K with employer match</li><li>Paid parental leave after one year of service</li></ul><p><br></p>Ad Hoc LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, pregnancy, disability, work-related injury, covered veteran status, political ideology, marital status, or any other factor that the law protects from employment discrimination.<p><br></p>In support of the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, and others like it across the country, Ad Hoc job descriptions feature the starting range we reasonably expect to pay to candidates who would join our team with little to no need for training on the responsibilities we've outlined above. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide range of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and responsibility. The range of starting pay for this role is $101,570 - $136,994 and information on benefits offered is here. Our recruiters will be happy to answer any questions you may have, and we look forward to learning more about your salary requirements.<p><br></p>job reference: 2015

title: Capital Finance Analyst
description: <u>Schaumburg, IL</u><p><br></p>Ready for a <u>Finance</u> career with more impact? Join a market leader in ingredient manufacturing that is poised for a new era of success.<p><br></p><strong>About Primient</strong><p><br></p><strong>Established yet entrepreneurial: </strong>Primient is an industry leader with proven products, six manufacturing plants, 1500+ employees and deep roots in corn wet milling. Yet we’re also a brand-new company that is ready to drive change and create impact.<p><br></p><strong>Inspired by a meaningful purpose: </strong>we use renewable sources to produce plant-based ingredients for some of the world’s best-known brands. It feels good to produce safe, high-quality, sustainable products – that go into everything from sodas to hand cream and cardboard to clothing.<p><br></p><strong>Poised for a new era of success: </strong>we’re investing in our plants and people to unlock our potential in the industrial and food sectors. Guided by our values of Safety, Excellence, Integrity, and Growth, we’re focused on growing our business, our reputation, and the career of every colleague.<p><br></p><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY</strong><p><br></p>The contribution of our Finance teams is vital to the performance, profitability, and continued growth of the Primient business. Across Finance, we are exploring new and better ways to harness data, improve decision-making and add value – while optimizing the investment we are making in our plants and people.<p><br></p>The Senior Financial Analyst (SFA) is a highly visible role that will be responsible for supporting the Global Process Engineering team day-to-day capital spending and cash flow activities as well as providing analysis to support overall operations finance. These finance activities include capital spending and manufacturing site reporting, operational and direct cost analysis, monthly capital spending and cashflow forecasting, annual budgeting, and miscellaneous project work. A successful candidate will be comfortable and seasoned in collaboration, as you will partner with senior leadership, operations management, supply chain and other cross-functional team members to deliver decision-making support for key deliverables and business initiatives. This position will report to the VP Operations Finance and be based in Schaumburg; Primient employees are currently working a hybrid schedule.<p><br></p>This is an exciting opportunity to come into a private equity-backed, market leading industrial manufacturer with a history of success and a strong reputation in the market. It has a long track record of success, a reputation for superior capabilities, and a diversified and marquee customer base for whom it creates mission critical products.<p><br></p><strong>Key responsibilities: <u>Capital Finance Analyst</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support and help preparing capital strategic business plans (5 year plan)</li><li>Ensure the integrity and accuracy of capital reporting. Work closely with controlling team to ensure elements capitalized match US GAAP definition</li><li>Support development of annual capital budgets, and monthly capex forecasts including analysis and variance explanations</li><li>Supports preparation of presentations for senior management team and assist VP Operations Finance with presentations to the Capital Engineering Team, COO and CFO</li><li>Prepare the 3 months rolling forecast</li><li>Support 13 week capital cash flow forecast for the Treasury team</li><li>Prepare financial capex analyses for major projects, ensuring alignment with business strategies, priorities, and financial requirements</li><li>Review financial analysis prepared by the plant for the small projects, especially ensuring capturing benefits and continuous improvement from capex</li><li>Provides financial consulting on key strategic initiatives and priorities to help the organization stay focused on achieving their strategic goals and capex budget – help reassessing financial implication/priorities when new projects not in AOP are needed</li><li>Support any special project work throughout the Operations team</li><li>Adhoc analysis &amp; other business requests - provide adhoc reports and analysis as needed to support overall business</li><li>Quickly develop a detailed understanding of the business, including products/services and operations sites</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About You</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA/BS Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field; MBA preferred</li><li>5 to 10 years of experience in financial analysis, financial/strategic planning, reporting or FP&amp;A</li><li>Prior experience with financial reporting systems and visualization tools, such as SAP, Planful, Onestream and Power BI</li><li>Excellent analytical skills and the ability to translate analytical findings into actionable solutions and processes</li><li>Broad overall business acumen with proficient ability to talk with executives in business terms</li><li>Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with fluctuating priorities and deadlines. Ability to work without direct supervision, and efficiently manage tasks and time</li><li>Hands on, deadline &amp; detail oriented</li><li>Team Player, Ownership, Drive for Results and Customer Focus</li><li>Occasional travel, typically less than 10%</li><li>Proficiency in Word, PowerPoint, Outlook required; Advanced Microsoft Excel skills includes analytical modeling, robust chart prep and data mining for large data sets</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and superlative listening skills</li><li>Keen attention to detail in planning, organization, and execution of tasks, while still maintaining focus on overall company objectives (“the big picture”)</li><li>Demonstration of innovation and initiative – always looking at improving our processes and displaying a willingness to dive into the details and help wherever necessary</li><li>Agile, resilient and hands on – can handle volume and pace</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Information</strong><p><br></p><strong>Rewards &amp; benefits </strong><p><br></p>Competitive salary / 401 K matching and non-contingent matching plans / Healthcare / Medical insurance<p><br></p><strong>Career development</strong><p><br></p>Our structure provides autonomy and accountability in your role. You have scope to develop a depth of expertise and the opportunity to follow career pathways outside the norm.<p><br></p><u>Preferred location is Schaumburg, IL or Decatur, IL.</u><p><br></p><strong>Diversity, Equity, Inclusion &amp; Belonging</strong><p><br></p>We are passionate believers in the power of difference. We strive to represent the communities in which we operate and to provide an inclusive, welcoming environment for all. We want Primient to be a place where every employee feels they belong and knows they are seen, heard, valued and safe to speak up. Our aspiration is to unlock the full potential in diverse perspectives, while offering everyone an equal chance to grow, thrive and progress.<p><br></p><strong>Primient is an equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of an inclusive workforce.</strong><p><br></p>California Consumer Privacy Act ("CCPA")<p><br></p>The Company is committed to complying with the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”) and all data privacy and laws in the jurisdictions in which it recruits and hires employees. We collect the following categories of personal information for the purpose of hiring the best qualified applicants and to comply with applicable employment laws: Name and contact information; Job preference and work availability; Social Security Number and/or other identification information; Education and qualifications; Employment history and experience; Military service; Reference and background check information, including relevant criminal history and credit history; Social media information; Pre-employment test results; Post-offer medical examination information and results, including drug test results; Voluntary self-disclosure information regarding minority, veteran, and disability status; and Information provided by you during the hiring process.

title: Front End Web Developer - Junior
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>Our Client is currently looking to fill a new Front End Developer position. This job will involve primarily working with the Mendix Enterprise Application cloud system with some experience with providing rapid customer solutions for various business needs. You will work with our business team to find out what their needs are. You will be assisting with analysis of the business teams requirements and advise them accordingly. Together with your project team, you will be responsible for the development, and implementation of the system.<br><br><strong>Duties And Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Development of high-quality applications in small teams with Front End development</li><li> Deduce and document use cases from customer requirements</li><li> Visual Modeling: Develop application workflows, Create integration interfaces via Web Services, Create Graphical User Interface Layouts.</li><li> Integration interfaces with custom JavaScript</li><li> Documentation of either or, user manuals, (non-)functional application requirements, business processes, work flows, project plans and planning, systems architecture, etc.</li><li> Ability to replicate UI/UX design in their development</li><li> Mendix Experience is a nice to have<br><br></li></ul><strong>Skills / Attributes Required<br></strong><ul><li> Expertise with web client languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)</li><li> Familiarity with web client frameworks (React or Angular)</li><li> Experience with source code management (Git is a plus)</li><li> Object oriented design skills and familiarity with JavaScript a plus Profile</li><li> 2 to 3 years of work experience in IT development and delivery.</li><li> Experience in customer-facing environments, with daily customer interaction.</li><li> Familiar with Agile practices.</li><li> Experience with both business and IT units</li><li> Eager to learn new technologies.</li><li> Excellent problem-solving skills.</li><li> Enthusiastic, creative and flexible.</li><li> Great communicative skills.<br><br></li></ul>
