title: Database Systems Engineer (2-year Term)
description: <strong>Department: </strong>IPR - Inst for Policy Res<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>ITS/80<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Center for Neighborhood Engaged Research &amp; Science (CORNERS) at Northwestern University is seeking a Database Systems Engineer to join our growing team. CORNERS conducts cutting-edge research into the ways that network and neighborhood science can be used to understand gun violence and help our community and civic partners build safer, healthier, more equitable neighborhoods. Learn more about our work at www.cornersresearch.org.<p><br></p>The Database Systems Engineer will manage all of CORNERS’ database and data/file management systems, including our Google Cloud Platform and secure SharePoint sites. We are looking for individuals with a broad technical skillset and strong communication skills. The Database Systems Engineer will serve as a liaison to various internal and external stakeholders, including Northwestern University’s IT community and data managers from CORNERS’ partner organizers. This individual will be responsible for helping debug issues related to data access and analysis and will serve as the Center’s primary data manager and as an analyst on our growing data team, when needed.<p><br></p>The Database Systems Engineer will be a full-time employee of Northwestern University with full benefits. They will work alongside CORNERS’ team members on the Evanston campus of Northwestern University.<p><br></p>This is a two-year, term-limited position. Opportunity for renewal will be based on performance and available funding.<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Strategic Planning </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Understands user objectives and goals and can translate those goals and objectives into actionable plans. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Administration </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Reviews and recommends enhancements to policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management. </li><li> Supports data backup and recovery processes. </li><li> Develops and maintains supporting documentation. </li><li> Ensures that appropriate patches are applied in a timely fashion. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Development </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Designs, configures and implements databases. </li><li> Creates database objects. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Performance </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Coordinates quality control and auditing of databases to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data. </li><li> Ensures data integrity. </li><li> Prioritizes and resolves database issues. </li><li> Coordinates maintenance and use of data dictionary. </li><li> Performs software installations and upgrades to databases. </li><li> Monitors and responds to security alerts. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong>      <ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree in a major such as computer science, information technology, or related; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> 2 years database administration or other relevant experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> Code Repositories (Git, Subversion) </li><li> identity management/provisioning </li><li> information security </li><li> Linux Operating System </li><li> Mac OS X Operating System </li><li> Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access, Outlook) </li><li> Microsoft SharePoint </li><li> SQL/MySQL/Postgres </li><li> Windows Operating System </li><li> Google Cloud Platform; virtual machine maintenance </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> Python </li><li> R </li></ul><li> Compliance</li><ul><li> IRB </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> critical thinking </li><li> data mining </li><li> data modeling </li><li> database design/ data structure </li><li> Debugging </li><li> judgment </li><li> metadata creation and management </li><li> problem solving </li><li> Troubleshooting </li><li> use-case analysis </li></ul><li> Project</li><ul><li> Code documentation </li><li> Collaboration and teamwork </li><li> Functional documentation </li><li> Organizational skills </li><li> Workflow development &amp; documentation </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Basic familiarity with command line coding. </li><li> Experience working with structured and relationship databases. </li><li> Respect and discretion when it comes to handling sensitive data. </li><li> Basic familiarity working with social science data. </li><li> Experience with basic statistical modeling of social science data. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Master’s degree at an accredited college or university OR undergraduate degree with equivalent work experience. Field of study open but technical training is required. </li><li> Proficiency in R required. </li><li> Experience with Python and SQL strongly preferred. </li><li> 4 years data management or similar experience required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong attention to detail. </li><li> Ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative and self-motivation required. </li><li> Ability to prioritize and balance competing demands and make decisions that you can stand by. </li><li> Excellent communication skills and experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders. </li><li> Experience scraping the web for data and/or creating datasets. </li><li> Experience building ETL (extract, transform, load) pipelines for processing, storing, and disseminating administrative data. </li><li> Experience developing and maintaining systems and culture for reproducible, transparent, version-controlled research and analysis using cloud storage and Git/GitHub. </li><li> Familiarity with geographic/spatial analysis. </li><li> Familiarity with network science and social network analysis. </li><li> Working knowledge of social science research design and statistical analysis. </li><li> Proficiency with various coding languages, (e.g., R, Python). </li><li> Proficiency with basic statistical software (e.g., R, Stata). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Work-Life And Wellness</u></strong><p><br></p>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<p><br></p>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.<br><br></em>
description_json: <strong>Department: </strong>IPR - Inst for Policy Res<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>ITS/80<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Center for Neighborhood Engaged Research &amp; Science (CORNERS) at Northwestern University is seeking a Database Systems Engineer to join our growing team. CORNERS conducts cutting-edge research into the ways that network and neighborhood science can be used to understand gun violence and help our community and civic partners build safer, healthier, more equitable neighborhoods. Learn more about our work at www.cornersresearch.org.<p><br></p>The Database Systems Engineer will manage all of CORNERS’ database and data/file management systems, including our Google Cloud Platform and secure SharePoint sites. We are looking for individuals with a broad technical skillset and strong communication skills. The Database Systems Engineer will serve as a liaison to various internal and external stakeholders, including Northwestern University’s IT community and data managers from CORNERS’ partner organizers. This individual will be responsible for helping debug issues related to data access and analysis and will serve as the Center’s primary data manager and as an analyst on our growing data team, when needed.<p><br></p>The Database Systems Engineer will be a full-time employee of Northwestern University with full benefits. They will work alongside CORNERS’ team members on the Evanston campus of Northwestern University.<p><br></p>This is a two-year, term-limited position. Opportunity for renewal will be based on performance and available funding.<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Strategic Planning </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Understands user objectives and goals and can translate those goals and objectives into actionable plans. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Administration </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Reviews and recommends enhancements to policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management. </li><li> Supports data backup and recovery processes. </li><li> Develops and maintains supporting documentation. </li><li> Ensures that appropriate patches are applied in a timely fashion. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Development </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Designs, configures and implements databases. </li><li> Creates database objects. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Performance </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Coordinates quality control and auditing of databases to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data. </li><li> Ensures data integrity. </li><li> Prioritizes and resolves database issues. </li><li> Coordinates maintenance and use of data dictionary. </li><li> Performs software installations and upgrades to databases. </li><li> Monitors and responds to security alerts. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong>      <ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree in a major such as computer science, information technology, or related; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> 2 years database administration or other relevant experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> Code Repositories (Git, Subversion) </li><li> identity management/provisioning </li><li> information security </li><li> Linux Operating System </li><li> Mac OS X Operating System </li><li> Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access, Outlook) </li><li> Microsoft SharePoint </li><li> SQL/MySQL/Postgres </li><li> Windows Operating System </li><li> Google Cloud Platform; virtual machine maintenance </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> Python </li><li> R </li></ul><li> Compliance</li><ul><li> IRB </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> critical thinking </li><li> data mining </li><li> data modeling </li><li> database design/ data structure </li><li> Debugging </li><li> judgment </li><li> metadata creation and management </li><li> problem solving </li><li> Troubleshooting </li><li> use-case analysis </li></ul><li> Project</li><ul><li> Code documentation </li><li> Collaboration and teamwork </li><li> Functional documentation </li><li> Organizational skills </li><li> Workflow development &amp; documentation </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Basic familiarity with command line coding. </li><li> Experience working with structured and relationship databases. </li><li> Respect and discretion when it comes to handling sensitive data. </li><li> Basic familiarity working with social science data. </li><li> Experience with basic statistical modeling of social science data. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Master’s degree at an accredited college or university OR undergraduate degree with equivalent work experience. Field of study open but technical training is required. </li><li> Proficiency in R required. </li><li> Experience with Python and SQL strongly preferred. </li><li> 4 years data management or similar experience required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong attention to detail. </li><li> Ability to work independently with a high degree of initiative and self-motivation required. </li><li> Ability to prioritize and balance competing demands and make decisions that you can stand by. </li><li> Excellent communication skills and experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders. </li><li> Experience scraping the web for data and/or creating datasets. </li><li> Experience building ETL (extract, transform, load) pipelines for processing, storing, and disseminating administrative data. </li><li> Experience developing and maintaining systems and culture for reproducible, transparent, version-controlled research and analysis using cloud storage and Git/GitHub. </li><li> Familiarity with geographic/spatial analysis. </li><li> Familiarity with network science and social network analysis. </li><li> Working knowledge of social science research design and statistical analysis. </li><li> Proficiency with various coding languages, (e.g., R, Python). </li><li> Proficiency with basic statistical software (e.g., R, Stata). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Work-Life And Wellness</u></strong><p><br></p>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<p><br></p>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.<br><br></em>

title: Financial Analyst
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Marketing Financial Analyst</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a skilled <strong>Marketing Financial Analyst</strong> to join our Clients Team. As a leading company in manufacturing, we value innovation and exceptional results. This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated individual with financial expertise to contribute to our growth in a marketing-focused role.<p><br></p><strong>Why work for this Team as a Marketing Financial Analyst:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Supportive and Collaborative Environment</li><li>Great Work Life Balance</li><li>Professional growth</li><li>401(k) with 3% company match</li><li>Health insurance</li><li>Dental &amp; Vision insurance</li><li>Paid Time off</li><li>Paid Holidays</li><li>AD&amp;D insurance</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities Of The Financial Analyst</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze marketing campaign data, evaluate ROI, and provide insights for strategic decision-making.</li><li>Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and risks.</li><li>Develop financial forecasts and budgets aligned with business objectives.</li><li>Collaborate with the Marketing team, track KPIs, and provide reports on campaign effectiveness.</li><li>Optimize marketing operations and provide recommendations for cost optimization.</li><li>Analyze customer data, optimize acquisition strategies, and enhance customer lifetime value.</li><li>Evaluate pricing strategies and promotional activities to maximize revenue.</li><li>Support business case development for new marketing initiatives.</li><li>Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications Preferred Of The Marketing Financial Analyst</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting </li><li>Proven experience as a Financial Analyst, with exposure to marketing analytics preferred.</li><li>Strong analytical skills and proficiency in financial modeling.</li><li>Advanced Excel skills and familiarity with data visualization software.</li><li>Understanding of marketing principles, metrics, and KPIs.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills.</li><li>Detail-oriented with strong organizational abilities.</li><li>Self-motivated and capable of working independently and in a team.</li><li>Knowledge of industry regulations and compliance is advantageous.</li></ul> <strong>Marketing Financial Analyst</strong><p><br></p>Id: EB-1586736598

title: Business Analyst with SFDC
description: <strong>The Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for but not limited to the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Launch new features or capabilities aligned to new or existing business processes or user groups</li><li>Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to drive projects and goals</li><li>Gather business requirements and develop new business processes as part of design activities</li><li>Performs data analysis of identified data issues, if needed</li><li>Identifies use cases and develops test scenarios</li><li>Write test scripts and participate in user acceptance testing</li><li>Develop business process and training documentation as needed</li><li>Perform new and existing user training sessions</li><li>Develop business readiness plans for tool or new capability launches, including change management, communication, and support plans</li><li>Develop strategies to drive adoption of tools, improve efficiencies and increase benefits to the data governance and analytics team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Knowledge &amp; Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8+ years of product planning, sales or IT experience</li><li>Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills with the ability to work under short deadlines</li><li>Self-motivated and ability to operate with limited direction in a fast-paced project-driven environment</li><li>Ability to foster collaborative and effective working relationships to build consensus with cross-functional teams such as regional sales operations, channel operations, IT, Software Enterprise, Services, Drop Ship, Legal, Marketing, Finance, Presales, Order Management, Post Sales, Supply Chain and Credit</li><li>Keen attention to detail and complex problem-solving abilities from an operational and technical perspective</li><li>Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written required</li><li>Experience working with ERP systems, Salesforce CRM &amp; other Business Operations IT applications</li><li>Supply Chain experience</li><li>Project Management is plus</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>

title: Salesforce Developer 1
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Company: Oak Street Health<br><br>Title: Jr. Salesforce Developer<br><br><strong><u>Company Description<br><br></u></strong>The mission of Oak Street Health is to rebuild healthcare as it should be.<br><br>We are a rapidly growing, innovative company of community-based healthcare centers delivering higher quality health and wellness care that improves outcomes, manages medical costs and provides an unmatched experience for adults on Medicare.<br><br>The Oak Street model integrates outstanding clinical expertise, technology, and teamwork to deliver improved care quality and cost savings. These cost savings are then reinvested into care in our communities, creating a virtuous cycle of improving community health.<br><br>We are a national organization serving <u>over 100,000 patients</u> and we are <u>growing rapidly</u>. We are a <u>diverse</u> team of care providers, service team members, technologists, community outreach experts, business professionals, and more -- all dedicated to our Oaky Values and motivated by our mission. We’re looking forward to getting to know you!<br><br>For more information, visit <u>www.oakstreethealth.com</u>.<br><br><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>The Jr. Salesforce Developer reports to the Salesforce Developer and is responsible for designing and implementing solutions that optimize the sales team’s workflows and help drive efficiency. The Jr. Salesforce Developer supports sales team members at all levels, and serves as a go-to resource for all CRM data management best practices.<br><br><strong><u>Core Responsibilities</u></strong><ul><li>Support the Salesforce Developer in designing and developing Salesforce solutions, which includes:</li><ul><li>Creating (design, document, build) and managing (test, deploy) changes to Lightning Web Components, Visualforce, Apex Classes, Apex Controllers, and Apex Triggers</li><li>Maintaining all third-party integrations related to Salesforce (i.e. CTI, website, marketing automation tool)</li><li>Coordinating and executing release/deployment processes</li><li>Collaborating with technical teams (i.e. IT, BI) to align on objectives and strategies, and identify opportunities for improvement</li></ul><li>Participate in design and code reviews to ensure development quality</li><li>Support day-to-day operations, including primary support for detection and correction of bugs or other technical issues</li><li>Other duties as assigned<br></li></ul>What are we looking for?<br><br><strong><u>We Are Looking For People That Have<br></u></strong><ul><li>1-3 years experience in Software Development, Cloud Technology, or a related space</li><li>Solid understanding of Java or similar OOP languages</li><li>Experience with relational databases (e.g. SOQL, MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, or other common RDBMS)</li><li>Working understanding of SOQL, SOSL, web services (SOAP or REST), Visualforce, APEX (Salesforce Platform Developer I certification preferred, but not required)</li><li>Eagerness for continuous learning and development </li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to work across the organization</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities while maintaining a positive attitude</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being scrappy<br></li></ul>Why Oak Street?<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Offers Our Coworkers The Opportunity To Be At The Forefront Of a Revolution In Healthcare, As Well As<br></u></strong><ul><li>Collaborative and energetic culture</li><li>Fast-paced and innovative environment</li><li>Competitive benefits including paid vacation and sick time, generous 401K match with immediate vesting, and health benefits<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers.

title: Database Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>A self-motivated individual responsible for database object design, development, maintenance for the enterprise application data model and database administration both on-premise and in the Azure Cloud. Ensures enterprise database procedures, methodologies and standards are maintained across the application teams. Performs database promotions to all servers per Service Level Agreements. Provides necessary production problem resolution to support departmental server up time goals. Assists with SQL Server upgrades to the Enterprise.<br><br>This is a Hybrid position- requires time in our Oakbrook Terrace, IL central office. Typically,1- 2 days per week and as needed..<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Provides login and security maintenance. </li><li> Monitors database performance. </li><li> Supports and provides tables, constraints, and triggers in a timely manner to several application development teams in a multi-tasking environment. </li><li> Reviews stored procedures and ensures that The Joint Commission database standards, guidelines, proper naming conventions and T-SQL coding techniques for optimal performance are enforced. </li><li> Creates logical and physical data model diagrams using 3 rd party tools. </li><li> Rotates on-call 24/7 production support. </li><li> Provides nonproduction and production promotions in a timely fashion according to SLA. </li><li> Monitors database integrity in a proactive manner. </li><li> Performs SQL Server installs and upgrades. </li><li> Supports the Disaster Recovery tests under supervision. </li><li> Performs other duties as requested by the team and business. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Three to five years’ experience in relational database systems. </li><li> Experience with implementing SSIS / SSRS. </li><li> BS, BA degree in computer science or equivalent experience. </li><li> Lean / Six Sigma Yellow Belt </li><li> Microsoft Certified Azure Data Fundamentals is a plus. </li><li> Knowledge of a scripting language, preferably PowerShell or JSON or Python. </li><li> Demonstrated knowledge of relational database concepts and modeling, with a high technical aptitude in database management. </li><li> Experience in the use of SQL and T-SQL for query and transaction processing. </li><li> Working knowledge of a programming environment (i.e. .Net Framework, Entity Framework). </li><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills. </li><li> Excellent troubleshooting and performance tuning skills. </li><li> Ability to use Profiler and DMV. </li><li> Experience with data modeling tools. </li><li> 1-2 years’ experience with SQL Azure or any other cloud database platform. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

title: Denodo Developer
description: Job Title: Denodo Sr. Developer<p><br></p>Experience: 7 to 10 yrs<p><br></p><strong><u>Top 3 Must Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Denodo</li><li> SQL</li><li> Informatica Data Quality</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Summary: Develop and implement data virtualization solutions using the Denodo Platform. Collaborate with business stakeholders and IT teams to gather requirements and design data virtualization solutions. Develop and maintain documentation related to data virtualization solutions. Develop and execute unit tests and integration tests for data virtualization solutions. Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to data virtualization solutions. Provide guidance and mentoring to junior team members.<p><br></p><strong><u>Roles &amp; Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data virtualization and related fields.</li><li> 5+ years of experience developing data virtualization solutions using the Denodo Platform.</li><li> Strong understanding of data virtualization concepts and best practices.</li><li> Proficient in SQL and database management systems.</li><li> Experience with ETL tools and techniques.</li><li> Experience with web services and API development.</li><li> Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li> Strong communication and interpersonal skills.</li><li> Ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li></ul>

title: Salesforce Developer I
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Company: Oak Street Health<br><br>Title: Jr. Salesforce Developer<br><br><strong><u>Company Description<br><br></u></strong>The mission of Oak Street Health is to rebuild healthcare as it should be.<br><br>We are a rapidly growing, innovative company of community-based healthcare centers delivering higher quality health and wellness care that improves outcomes, manages medical costs and provides an unmatched experience for adults on Medicare.<br><br>The Oak Street model integrates outstanding clinical expertise, technology, and teamwork to deliver improved care quality and cost savings. These cost savings are then reinvested into care in our communities, creating a virtuous cycle of improving community health.<br><br>We are a national organization serving <u>over 100,000 patients</u> and we are <u>growing rapidly</u>. We are a <u>diverse</u> team of care providers, service team members, technologists, community outreach experts, business professionals, and more -- all dedicated to our Oaky Values and motivated by our mission. We’re looking forward to getting to know you!<br><br>For more information, visit <u>www.oakstreethealth.com</u>.<br><br><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>The Jr. Salesforce Developer reports to the Salesforce Developer and is responsible for designing and implementing solutions that optimize the sales team’s workflows and help drive efficiency. The Jr. Salesforce Developer supports sales team members at all levels, and serves as a go-to resource for all CRM data management best practices.<br><br><strong><u>Core Responsibilities</u></strong><ul><li>Support the Salesforce Developer in designing and developing Salesforce solutions, which includes:</li><ul><li>Creating (design, document, build) and managing (test, deploy) changes to Lightning Web Components, Visualforce, Apex Classes, Apex Controllers, and Apex Triggers</li><li>Maintaining all third-party integrations related to Salesforce (i.e. CTI, website, marketing automation tool)</li><li>Coordinating and executing release/deployment processes</li><li>Collaborating with technical teams (i.e. IT, BI) to align on objectives and strategies, and identify opportunities for improvement</li></ul><li>Participate in design and code reviews to ensure development quality</li><li>Support day-to-day operations, including primary support for detection and correction of bugs or other technical issues</li><li>Other duties as assigned<br></li></ul>What are we looking for?<br><br><strong><u>We Are Looking For People That Have<br></u></strong><ul><li>1-3 years experience in Software Development, Cloud Technology, or a related space</li><li>Solid understanding of Java or similar OOP languages</li><li>Experience with relational databases (e.g. SOQL, MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, or other common RDBMS)</li><li>Working understanding of SOQL, SOSL, web services (SOAP or REST), Visualforce, APEX (Salesforce Platform Developer I certification preferred, but not required)</li><li>Eagerness for continuous learning and development </li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to work across the organization</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities while maintaining a positive attitude</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being scrappy<br></li></ul>Why Oak Street?<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Offers Our Coworkers The Opportunity To Be At The Forefront Of a Revolution In Healthcare, As Well As<br></u></strong><ul><li>Collaborative and energetic culture</li><li>Fast-paced and innovative environment</li><li>Competitive benefits including paid vacation and sick time, generous 401K match with immediate vesting, and health benefits<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers.

match with immediate vesting, and health benefits<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers.

title: Software Engineer Back-end
description: <p>Lily &amp; Fox is experiencing tremendous growth and we think you can help!<br><br></p> <p>We believe beauty should be more accessible, because everyone deserves to know they are pretty. We believe personalized products are the future of cosmetics. We are starting with nails. Our mission is to redefine manicures for 8 billion people - change your nails as easily as changing your clothes. Join us in making this reality.<br><br></p> <p>What you’ll do:<br><br></p> <p>Work with our Inventory, Quality Control, Design, Production, Customer Happiness, and Fulfillment Teams to help design, develop, and support world-class software systems. Here are examples of projects you will work on:<br><br></p> <ul><li>Improve page speed of our website - page load times under 1 second</li><li>Architect and implement a Product Information Management tool to manage tens of thousands of SKUs</li><li>Architect and implement a demand forecasting and inventory planning tool for thousands of SKUs with millions of transactions</li><li>Architect and implement custom search and collection sorting, to personalize every visitor’s site experience</li><li>Work with our data science function to improve our existing customer retention AI models and connect this to how our fulfillment teams fulfill each customer’s order<br><br></li></ul> <p>Your role will consist of:<br><br></p> <ul><li>Creating mockups</li><li>Helping to implement these mockups alongside our Engineering Team</li><li>Write and perform tests</li><li>Perform user research<br><br></li></ul> <p>Who we are looking for:<br><br></p> <ul><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English</li><li>You're excited to get things done, in a fast-paced environment</li><li>You work well in teams and enjoy collaborating with others</li><li>Strong background in back-end software development (Node.js experience is a plus, but not a requirement)</li><li>Demonstrated exceptional ability</li><li>Experience building REST APIs</li><li>Experience with RDBMS (Postgres experience is a plus, but not a requirement)<br><br></li></ul> <p>Nice to have:<br><br></p> <ul><li>Experience with performance testing software</li><li>Experience writing Python web services and scripts</li><li>Experience with RDBMS (Postgres)</li><li>Experience with CI/CD (Docker, Jenkins, Git)</li><li>Experience with testing (Jest, Mocha)<br><br></li></ul> <p>The interview process will consist of the following stages:<br><br></p> <ul><li>Initial Phone Call</li><li>Culture &amp; Personality &amp; Technical Assessment</li><li>System Design Interview</li><li>Algorithms &amp; Data Structures Interview</li><li>In-Person Technical Interview and Culture Interview (2 x 1hr on same day)<br><br></li></ul> <p>You will be joining a small, tight-knit Engineering Team, and will report directly to our CEO/CTO.<br><br></p> <p>What Lily &amp; Fox Offers:<br><br></p> <ul><li>Attractive salary + equity</li><li>Whatever equipment you need to excel</li><li>100% company paid insurance (medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance)</li><li>5 weeks PTO per year (vacation, sick, holidays)</li><li>Coaching and training</li><li>Huge opportunities to learn new skills and grow with the company!<br><br></li></ul> <p>If you love the idea of working with a team who:<br><br></p> <ul><li>Do the impossible</li><li>Take chances</li><li>Learn continuously</li><li>Are team-oriented</li><li>Strive to know the future<br><br></li></ul> <p>You’ll love working with us.<br><br></p> <p>This is not a work from home position.<br><br></p> <p>Good luck to everyone who applies!<br><br></p> <p>Equal Employment Opportunity:<br><br></p> <p>Lily and Fox are committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all employment practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, protected veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br></p> <p>To read more about Equal Employment Opportunity please see attached links:<br><br></p> <p>https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal-poster<br><br></p> <p>https://www.eeoc.gov/laws/guidance/what-you-should-know-questions-and-answers-about-genetic-information<br><br></p> <p>Type: Full-time, on-site<br><br></p>

title: Software Engineer
description: Location <strong>IL, Mt. Prospect</strong><p><br></p>Department <strong>Engineering</strong><p><br></p>Employment Type <strong>Full Time</strong><p><br></p><strong>Software Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Crane Payment Innovations</strong><p><br></p><strong>Mount Prospect, IL</strong><p><br></p>Crane Payment Innovations is the leader in world class automated payment solutions. We partner with businesses to provide payment experiences that set new and innovative standards for consumer convenience, security and reliability. We are excited to explore new ways every day to improve how millions of people across the globe can make their payments in a way that fits with their lives. Our global engineers develop products and deliver innovative solutions in currency validation technologies, cash management systems, digital payment technologies, mobile applications, security and digital advertising. We offer a range of devices for bill and coin validation, cash recycling and dispensing systems, IoT applications for our enterprise-level connected products and services, and software applications to integrate sensory hardware to machines and networks.<p><br></p>At CPI you will become a valuable part of an inclusive culture of collaboration and innovation with the support of over 2,000 associates working in one of our 15 offices across the world. If you want to have a hands-on global impact on payment solutions, we want you to join our team as a Software Engineer. This is a full-time position based at our Mt. Prospect Office in the Chicagoland area.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Function</u></strong><p><br></p>The <strong>Software Engineer</strong> will design and develop software to support our existing coin or note counters. This individual will assist with all phases of the software development cycle.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities And Duties</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Technical skill sets:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experienced in designing and testing new code in C/C++ for or Linux or Windows environment</li><li>Writing web-based applications using ASP, HTML5, JavaScript</li><li>Using installation tools to create and maintain Linux or Windows based installation packages</li><li>Provide support and development for automation test scripts</li><li>Utilizing version control system to manage product revisions: Git and ClearCase</li><li>Creating and maintaining issues using JIRA</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot and debug for root cause of system/subsystem failures</li><li>Experienced in adhering to an established engineering development process, – CPI EDP – (proof-of-concept, prototyping, design, integration/test, associated documentation)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Core Skillsets</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work in a cross functional team environment</li><li>Good communications skillsets (verbal, written, presenting, etc.)</li><li>Computer skillsets (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Electrical Design ( IDEs ), etc</li><li>Self-Motivated – takes initiative to address issues, pursue new designs, identify cost reductions, researching of new parts</li><li>Innovative – Ability to design from a broad mandate statement, thinking out of the box, etc</li><li>Accountable – Assumes full responsibility of their designs or other designs which they have been assigned to maintain or debug</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Value Added Skillsets</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with Kaizen methodology and Continuous Improvement Tools</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications And Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering or title: Quality Control Analyst
description: <strong>Job Title:</strong> Quality Control Analyst<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong>Hire Type:</strong> Contract<p><br></p><strong>Overview:</strong><p><br></p>Sterling has helped build careers for thousands of professionals like yourself. Our expert recruiters support you at every step in the process and as a Best of Staffing company, Sterling provides exciting work with exceptional employers across the U.S.<p><br></p>As a contract employee of Sterling, you are eligible to receive a <strong>Full Em</strong><strong>ployee Benefits Package </strong>that includes <strong>paid time off, paid holidays, 3 medical plans to choose from, dental &amp; vision plans, 401(k), and an Employee Stock Ownership (ESOP) plan.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary: </strong><p><br></p>The Quality Control Analyst is responsible for analytical testing and data verification supporting both late-stage clinical and commercial biosimilar products in cGMP-compliant laboratories. This individual will also engage in continuous improvement initiatives to drive efficiency and effectiveness of Quality Systems. A strong background in protein chemistry will be essential to perform and troubleshoot techniques such as HPLC, SDS-PAGE, cell-based bioassays, capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, ELISA, and standard compendial assays. A demonstrated ability to collaborate across multiple departments to drive timely resolution of projects, laboratory investigations, and process improvements is required.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analytical testing to support product in-process, release, and stability programs.</li><li>Knowledge of cGMP, Quality Systems, and ICH / regulatory guidance.</li><li>Conduct, compile, and/or review Out of Specification lab investigations, deviations, and corrective and preventative actions plans.</li><li>Work with cross-functional teams to advance projects, maintain equipment, and author documents and reports.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in biotechnology, biochemistry, chemistry, or related field</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of experience in a pharmaceutical/biotech QC laboratory. </li><li>Alternatively, Master’s degree in above areas with 1 year of experience in a pharmaceutical/biotech QC laboratory or PhD in above areas.</li><li>Demonstrated success working with techniques such as HPLC, SDS-PAGE, cell-based bioassays, capillary electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE, ELISA, and standard compendial assays. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em>#post</em></strong>

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
description: <strong>Job TITLE: </strong>Business Intelligence (BI) Developer<br><br><strong><u>Job DESCRIPTION<br><br></u></strong><strong>The BI Developer </strong>builds, maintains, and improves data transformations, data repositories and related reports and dashboards<strong>. The BI Developer will work closely with the data architect, business analysts, and IT leadership to deliver and improve data and reporting solutions for the organization.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job RESPONSIBILITIES<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design, develop, improve, verify, and support custom Data Warehouse, Data Marts, and Power BI visualizations, dashboards, and paginated reports</li><li>Design, develop, and maintain Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) packages to extract, transform, and load data into data repositories </li><li>Understand data and process flows to investigate, track, manage, communicate, and improve data issues across systems</li><li>Enhance existing data models to implement new measures, facts, and dimensions </li><li>Create and modify SQL views and stored procedures</li><li>Ensure code management best practices</li><li>Daily monitoring and error handling of data solutions to ensure data availability</li><li>Maintain data refreshes and gateway connections, troubleshoot data refresh failures; provide after-hours support when needed <br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge, SKILLS, AND Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Extensive SQL development, SSIS, and ETL/ELT experience required</li><li>Extensive experience with Power BI desktop and paginated reports, workspaces, applications, and DAX measures required</li><li>Knowledge of dimensional modeling and data translation concepts and practices required</li><li>Prior ERP experience preferred</li><li>Manufacturing and distribution industry experience preferred</li><li>QlikView and Crystal Reports experience a plus</li><li>Must be able to manage multiple work items at one time with a high sense of urgency.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to collaborate and communicate well with team members and stakeholders </li><li>Must possess strong problem solving and organizational skills<br></li></ul><strong>EDUCATION:</strong> Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience<br><br><strong>EXPERIENCE:</strong> 3 - 5 years of experience as a BI Developer<br><br><strong>WORK LOCATION:</strong> Gurnee, Illinois<br><br><strong>Employment Status:</strong> Full Time<br><br><strong>Travel required:</strong> N/A

title: DevOps Python Engineer
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a DevOps Python Engineer. Candidate will provide services to DevOps team to complete buildout of CD automation for application release deployments based on a bill of material YAML file that has all necessary information the automation will need to deploy our applications to test and production environments.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide services to DevOps team to develop python applications to automate checks for security and compliance controls before deploying release</li><li>Support and troubleshoot any issues in environments the deployment automation is tested and/or used in</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Python programming experience required (application programming, NOT Scripting)</li><li>Hands on experience with DevOps tools</li><li>GitHub</li><li>Jenkins</li><li>Terraform (Enterprise preferred)/ansible</li><li>Artifactory</li><li>Experience in following technologies</li><li>Kubernetes &amp; Helm</li><li>Hashicorp Vault</li><li>Docker (containerize applications &amp; best practices)</li><li>Harness</li></ul>

description: Salary: Open + Bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in Chicago, IL<p><br></p>*This role is unable to provide sponsorship*<p><br></p>*Must be available for on-site interviews*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree required; masters preferred.</li><li>7+ years .NET and C# development experience</li><li>5+ years of JavaScript experience, including React and typescript.</li><li>2+ years working in AWS cloud.</li><li>2+ years Java development, 3+ years developing quantitative financial models.</li><li>Experience as architect for both Front End and Back End solutions. </li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience following Git workflows.</li><li>Working knowledge of DevOps tools. eg, Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm, and CI/CD pipeline etc.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Review and signoff of test plans and results for Risk Pillar of company Renaissance Initiative.</li><li>Maintenance of MRM's custom Risk Systems Control Tool. title: System Engineer
description: Weekly outpatient therapy isn't always enough, and a trip to the ER isn't the only answer. Patients and their families rely on Compass Health Center when in crisis – every day, we help people overcome depression, anxiety, suicidality, obsessions/compulsions, trauma, chronic pain, and other obstacles in order for our patients to live freely.<br><br><strong>About This Role<br><br></strong>Compass Health Center is seeking a <strong>Systems Engineer </strong>to join our growing organization. This position will report to our Associate Director, IT Infrastructure and will be responsible for developing and maintaining the computing systems used to deliver our clinical care and its increased reliance on technology.<br><br>We are a leading provider in the mental health space. Our rapid growth continues to create greater technology needs in all dimensions. The <strong>Systems Engineer </strong>will play an integral role in our day-to-day operations as well as supporting the growth of both virtual working staff and additional facility-based services.<br><br>As we grow, our goal is to create a technology model that provides a stable, secure, and replicable environment for delivering on our care mission. This role will help Compass make IT a leading capability in crisis-level mental health treatment.<br><br>This role is a hybrid role – remote and in our Northbrook, IL office. Our location in Northbrook is our first and largest facility, and consists not only of our widest variety of programs, but also serves as a pilot site for many of our new treatment offerings.<br><br><strong>What you'll do: <br><br></strong><ul><li>Support a Windows/M365/Azure environment with an emphasis on Azure AD/AADDS, M365 cloud services and Windows server functionality</li><li>Administer the Azure Tenant with a focus on availability, security, health and optimization</li><li>Manage and Administer Microsoft Teams, Exchange, OneDrive, and SharePoint Online, Intune and Defender. This includes provisioning of sites and services, managing permissions and configuration of features and monitoring the overall health of these services</li><li>Responsible for administration of Intune to manage mobile devices</li><li>Ensure security, governance, and compliance for the Azure/M365 platform</li><li>Manage VMWare vSphere 7 infrastructure including - hardware installations, software server deployments, systems updates, and Veeam backup &amp; replication</li><li>Manage and maintain an HA enterprise environment to ensure an uptime of 99.9%</li><li>Responsible for monitoring infrastructure, services, and applications hosted on-prem and in the cloud</li><li>Diagnose and resolve system and infrastructure problems quickly</li><li>Strong knowledge of networking: TCP/IP, LAN / DMZ / WAN, DHCP, DNS, Routing Protocols, Switching and Firewalls</li><li>Responsible for system patching/updates on a regular basis</li><li>Ensure all data is backed up and secured</li><li>Provide on-call support; part of an on-call rotation with other engineers<br><br></li></ul><strong>Who you are: <br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline; equivalent experience acceptable</li><li>2+ years of systems deployment, server migration, Microsoft server upgrades, and systems integration</li><li>2+ years proven work experience administering M365/O365 environments</li><li>2+ years of hands-on experience with VMWare platform.</li><li>Hands on experience with M365 configuration and migrations (Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Azure AD)</li><li>Knowledge of Microsoft Exchange and core elements: Active Directory, Federation Services, DNS, Mail Flow and Connectors, Outlook configuration, SMTP, SSL/TLS</li><li>Advanced proficiency with vSphere, vSAN, vCloud Director, and other VMware products and platforms</li><li>Experience with MFA and SSO identity and authentication systems, such as Azure AD, ADFS, or SAML</li><li>Experience with automation tools and scripting, including PowerShell, to manage and automate M365 services</li><li>Preferred professional IT certifications, such as: VMWare VCP, Azure Solutions Architect<br><br></li></ul><em>We know job descriptions can be intimidating, so if this sounds like an opportunity for you, please don't hesitate to apply!<br><br></em><strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>Compass Health Center is a recognized leader in crisis-level mental health, bringing passion, connection, and patient-centered care to the Partial Hospitalization and Intensive Outpatient space (PHP/IOP). Based in Chicagoland, we serve hundreds of patients every day, ranging from ages 5 through adulthood, in our onsite facilities or through our flourishing virtual programming. Compass fills a critical gap between outpatient and inpatient care through an intermediate level of Behavioral Healthcare.<br><br>A few more things we want you to know: our values are super important to us, and hopefully will be to you, too. Cultural humility, teamwork, continuous improvement, connection, patient centered care, passion, innovation, and agility should be your power sources. Joining Compass is an opportunity to feel fulfilled through a joint mission towards healing our communities.<br><br><strong>Benefits &amp; Perks<br><br></strong>We know that you will be dedicated to your purpose here. We look at that investment as a two-way street. We are proud to offer plenty of space for growth, and opportunities to pursue continuous development within our organization.<br><br>Our other benefits include: comprehensive medical/dental/vision plans, 401k program with company matching, generous PTO (including competitive parental leave after 1 year of employment), and continuous training through CEU seminars and volunteering opportunities.<br><br><strong>What’s Next?<br><br></strong>Compass is committed to cultivating diverse and dynamic teams who exude passion for their craft, so whether or not you check all the boxes, we encourage you to apply – we’d be grateful to hear from you!

This role will help Compass make IT a leading capability in crisis-level mental health treatment.<br><br>This role is a hybrid role – remote and in our Northbrook, IL office. Our location in Northbrook is our first and largest facility, and consists not only of our widest variety of programs, but also serves as a pilot site for many of our new treatment offerings.<br><br><strong>What you'll do: <br><br></strong><ul><li>Support a Windows/M365/Azure environment with an emphasis on Azure AD/AADDS, M365 cloud services and Windows server functionality</li><li>Administer the Azure Tenant with a focus on availability, security, health and optimization</li><li>Manage and Administer Microsoft Teams, Exchange, OneDrive, and SharePoint Online, Intune and Defender. This includes provisioning of sites and services, managing permissions and configuration of features and monitoring the overall health of these services</li><li>Responsible for administration of Intune to manage mobile devices</li><li>Ensure security, governance, and compliance for the Azure/M365 platform</li><li>Manage VMWare vSphere 7 infrastructure including - hardware installations, software server deployments, systems updates, and Veeam backup &amp; replication</li><li>Manage and maintain an HA enterprise environment to ensure an uptime of 99.9%</li><li>Responsible for monitoring infrastructure, services, and applications hosted on-prem and in the cloud</li><li>Diagnose and resolve system and infrastructure problems quickly</li><li>Strong knowledge of networking: TCP/IP, LAN / DMZ / WAN, DHCP, DNS, Routing Protocols, Switching and Firewalls</li><li>Responsible for system patching/updates on a regular basis</li><li>Ensure all data is backed up and secured</li><li>Provide on-call support; part of an on-call rotation with other engineers<br><br></li></ul><strong>Who you are: <br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline; equivalent experience acceptable</li><li>2+ years of systems deployment, server migration, Microsoft server upgrades, and systems integration</li><li>2+ years proven work experience administering M365/O365 environments</li><li>2+ years of hands-on experience with VMWare platform.</li><li>Hands on experience with M365 configuration and migrations (Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Azure AD)</li><li>Knowledge of Microsoft Exchange and core elements: Active Directory, Federation Services, DNS, Mail Flow and Connectors, Outlook configuration, SMTP, SSL/TLS</li><li>Advanced proficiency with vSphere, vSAN, vCloud Director, and other VMware products and platforms</li><li>Experience with MFA and SSO identity and authentication systems, such as Azure AD, ADFS, or SAML</li><li>Experience with automation tools and scripting, including PowerShell, to manage and automate M365 services</li><li>Preferred professional IT certifications, such as: VMWare VCP, Azure Solutions Architect<br><br></li></ul><em>We know job descriptions can be intimidating, so if this sounds like an opportunity for you, please don't hesitate to apply!<br><br></em><strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>Compass Health Center is a recognized leader in crisis-level mental health, bringing passion, connection, and patient-centered care to the Partial Hospitalization and Intensive Outpatient space (PHP/IOP). Based in Chicagoland, we serve hundreds of patients every day, ranging from ages 5 through adulthood, in our onsite facilities or through our flourishing virtual programming. Compass fills a critical gap between outpatient and inpatient care through an intermediate level of Behavioral Healthcare.<br><br>A few more things we want you to know: our values are super important to us, and hopefully will be to you, too. Cultural humility, teamwork, continuous improvement, connection, patient centered care, passion, innovation, and agility should be your power sources. Joining Compass is an opportunity to feel fulfilled through a joint mission towards healing our communities.<br><br><strong>Benefits &amp; Perks<br><br></strong>We know that you will be dedicated to your purpose here. We look at that investment as a two-way street. We are proud to offer plenty of space for growth, and opportunities to pursue continuous development within our organization.<br><br>Our other benefits include: comprehensive medical/dental/vision plans, 401k program with company matching, generous PTO (including competitive parental leave after 1 year of employment), and continuous training through CEU seminars and volunteering opportunities.<br><br><strong>What’s Next?<br><br></strong>Compass is committed to cultivating diverse and dynamic teams who exude passion for their craft, so whether or not you check all the boxes, we encourage you to apply – we’d be grateful to hear from you!

title: Technology Operations Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>About The Role:</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking aTechnology Operations Engineer and our Operations Team is at the intersection of trading, development, and systems administration and plays an integral part of our firms success. The team manages the deployments, scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting for multiple trading strategies. We are seeking an individual to help us solve complex problems and improve our processes and tools. The ideal candidate is someone with a strong sense of ownership who can anticipate challenges.Must be open to working a rotating schedule which will include US and Asia shifts.<p><br></p><strong><u>What Youll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitor the trading system and work to identify and resolve issues</li><li>Identify, diagnose and troubleshoot complex problems to keep trading online</li><li>Work with Risk and Trading desks to understand and facilitate trading requirements</li><li>Manage daily changes and communicate status to the company</li><li>Automate software distribution and deployments for Linux and Windows applications to speed up our application deployments</li><li>Build new tools to manage our system and reduce effort and errors</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>What Were Looking For:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field</li><li>Financial industry experience is required</li><li>1-3 years of experience using, managing, or developing on Linux systems</li><li>Fluent with Windows and Linux platforms</li><li>Proficient in a scripting language, preferably Python</li><li>Comfortable with distributed version control like Git, Mercurial, or Subversion</li><li>Familiar with configuration management systems like Salt, Puppet, or Chef</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools, such as Solarwinds, Nagios, Cacti, etc.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks with high attention to detail in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Motivated to identify and problem solve issues in a timely manner</li></ul><p><br></p>OOJ-1303<p><br></p><strong><u>Why Is This a Great Opportunity</u></strong><p><br></p>Client is a privately held global prop trading firm. Collaborative and innovative work culture. Great work life balance. Client typically moves fast throughout the interview process.<p><br></p><strong>Salary Type </strong>: Annual Salary<p><br></p><strong>Salary Min </strong>: 120000<p><br></p><strong>Salary Max </strong>: 140000<p><br></p><strong>Currency Type </strong>: US Dollars

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>The scope of the Infrastructure Engineer role includes building, managing, and supporting core infrastructure and security services in public cloud to deliver highly available and scalable services, and meet security and compliance objectives. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining complex workflows using Unica software. You will support Infrastructure maintenance activities - Patching, Decomm, Filesystems and other infra related activity including the application upgrade and the performance of the application.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Collaborates with business partners to design, build and code cross-channel communications using campaign platforms such as Unica Campaign.</li><li>Responsible for administration of UNICA Campaign and UNICA Marketing Operations</li><li>This will also include providing UNICA platform security management, application and underlying infrastructure support (OS, Storage, Application, Web and Database).</li><li>Translates and conveys business solutions and strategies into system and database architecture.</li><li>Designs and builds strategies, processes, and technology solutions that support business needs and align with industry best practices.</li><li>Ability to create and translate complex SQL queries to support ad-hoc business requests.</li><li>Identifies data solutions to support complex campaigns including SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, flat files, and data warehouses.</li><li>Develops and maintains best practices and standard operating procedures for campaigns.</li><li>Serves as the primary liaison to technology partners for issue escalation, and resolution.</li><li>Troubleshooting technical issues and providing technical support to Business partners</li><li>Maintaining and updating the workflow automation environment to ensure optimization.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related</li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SQL competency, Linux Command Line competency</li><li>System Architecture experience</li><li>Experience working with Unica Campaign Management platforms.</li><li>UNICA campaign management product expertise – Administrative</li><li>Unica flowcharts experience</li><li>Experience with ETL Tools (Ab Initio, Data Stage, Informatica)</li><li>Experience in programming languages (Unix scripting, Python, Java, etc…)</li><li>Proficient in UNIX, and Linux</li><li>Proficiency in Scripting (Batch/Shell/Java Script).</li><li>Linux korn shell scripting knowledge </li><li>Websphere knowledge </li><li>SSH, SAS experience, SFTP competency</li><li>Experienced in other technology tools and stacks such as CI/CD, Jenkins, GitHub, Spark, and Open Source</li><li>Experience with scheduling tools: Autosys , Maestro</li><li>Experience working in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) </li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

The objective of this role is to enhance the company's Sustainability Footprint/Reporting with respect to the company's internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have strong project management experience within a large, global company. The Role: Provides project management support for annual sustainability disclosures Conducts research and benchmark review to help advise the company's sustainability reporting strategy Monitors key milestones and deliverables from global sustainability steering committee Manages engagement with ESG rating agencies to verify company information Supports IT general controls for ESG data collection software Supports data collection of environmental data into central software platform, conducts analysis of site progress, and supports site sustainability teams Manages a Sustainability Analyst You: 5 year of experience in sustainability, project management, quality assurance or supply chain ideally within a large global company Bachelor's degree required Excellent communication skills and high proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite 2 years of management experience Ability to travel A1339255CHI-PERM_1687296167 To Apply for this Job Click Here

title: .NET Developer III
description: Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP)<p><br></p>Our business continues to grow rapidly year over year. We are looking to beef up our Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) team to join us full time. This individual will be working in a fast-pace environment and must be ready to hit the ground running. Also, our company likes to invest in our team so we always encourage ongoing training and always have company outings to celebrate our success! If you feel like you are ready to work in a heavy and fast pace business and ideally you feel like this aligns with what you are looking for in your next MSP company, please keep reading…<p><br></p>The Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) must have excellent customer service skills and a desire to increase knowledge of cloud technology, virtualization, and networks for small-to-medium business solutions. The Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) will support projects O365/Azure deployments, virtualizing servers via Hyper-V/VMware, Server/Desktop support, and Networking configurations (SonicWall and Cisco Meraki) support. The Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) will grow into leadership role where they will be the technical expert for all infrastructure-related outages, failures, and problems.<p><br></p><strong><u>Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience doing End User IT Support, Cloud, O365 troubleshooting/administration, basic virtualization,</li><li>Windows Systems Administration, and general Network Administration (TCP/IP)</li><li>Experience in general Network Administration/Troubleshooting</li><li>Ability to perform end-to-end troubleshooting of issues, where the problem may lie in the storage, server, network, or anywhere in between</li><li>MS Office 365 administration with domain synchronization and migrations</li><li>Network background working with Firewalls / Routing / Switching</li><li>Extensive knowledge in Installation &amp; configuration of Windows Servers</li><li>Extensive knowledge of ConnectWise or other ticketing / RMM experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Salary $65k -$85k</li><li>Company Performance Bonuses</li><li>Medical/ Dental/ Life Insurance</li><li>PTO</li><li>401(k) w/ match</li><li>Certification Reimbursement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Opportunity Location </strong><p><br></p>Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong> Proposed Salary </strong><p><br></p>$65,000 - $85,000<p><br></p>Bowman Williams is a national specialized staffing firm for Cloud Service Providers and Managed Service Providers. Ranked by Forbes as one of America's top 200 Best Staffing Firms in America, we are a good resource for candidates looking to advance their careers in the Cloud Solutions and Services industry.<p><br></p>Tagged: #EB777<p><br></p><strong> Apply For This Opening </strong><p><br></p>Apply To Bowman Williams

If you feel like you are ready to work in a heavy and fast pace business and ideally you feel like this aligns with what you are looking for in your next MSP company, please keep reading…<p><br></p>The Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) must have excellent customer service skills and a desire to increase knowledge of cloud technology, virtualization, and networks for small-to-medium business solutions. The Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) will support projects O365/Azure deployments, virtualizing servers via Hyper-V/VMware, Server/Desktop support, and Networking configurations (SonicWall and Cisco Meraki) support. The Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) will grow into leadership role where they will be the technical expert for all infrastructure-related outages, failures, and problems.<p><br></p><strong><u>Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience doing End User IT Support, Cloud, O365 troubleshooting/administration, basic virtualization,</li><li>Windows Systems Administration, and general Network Administration (TCP/IP)</li><li>Experience in general Network Administration/Troubleshooting</li><li>Ability to perform end-to-end troubleshooting of issues, where the problem may lie in the storage, server, network, or anywhere in between</li><li>MS Office 365 administration with domain synchronization and migrations</li><li>Network background working with Firewalls / Routing / Switching</li><li>Extensive knowledge in Installation &amp; configuration of Windows Servers</li><li>Extensive knowledge of ConnectWise or other ticketing / RMM experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Hybrid Mid-Level System Engineer (MSP) Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Salary $65k -$85k</li><li>Company Performance Bonuses</li><li>Medical/ Dental/ Life Insurance</li><li>PTO</li><li>401(k) w/ match</li><li>Certification Reimbursement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Opportunity Location </strong><p><br></p>Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong> Proposed Salary </strong><p><br></p>$65,000 - $85,000<p><br></p>Bowman Williams is a national specialized staffing firm for Cloud Service Providers and Managed Service Providers. Ranked by Forbes as one of America's top 200 Best Staffing Firms in America, we are a good resource for candidates looking to advance their careers in the Cloud Solutions and Services industry.<p><br></p>Tagged: #EB777<p><br></p><strong> Apply For This Opening </strong><p><br></p>Apply To Bowman Williams
