title: Front End Developer
description: <strong>Job Purpose</strong><p><br></p>The purpose of this position is to contribute to the design, development and manufacturing of world class rail products and services vital to our customer’s needs through the application of specialized knowledge, skills, and abilities. Work involves independent judgement, decision making, and creativity. Management is available to provide additional guidance for unusual situations.<p><br></p><strong>Req ID</strong><p><br></p>8395BR<p><br></p><strong>Work Location Options</strong><p><br></p>LaGrange<p><br></p><strong>City</strong><p><br></p>La Grange<p><br></p><strong>State:</strong><p><br></p>Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>Railroads transport goods and people millions of miles every day. At Progress Rail, we believe in going the distance with them. We are looking for talented and innovative team players to address the challenges of the rail industry today, ensuring success for the future. Build a long-term career with opportunities for growth and advancement as part of a vibrant network of close to 200 global locations. Our innovative team members work together to forge the bridge between ideas and success!<p><br></p>As a Caterpillar company, Progress Rail is an integrated rolling stock and infrastructure provider, delivering a full range of products and services to domestic and international railroad customers. Our customers enjoy one-stop shopping and comprehensive railway solutions – whether it rolls on the rail or is the rail itself. From locomotives, transit, freight cars and engines, to tracks, signals and advanced technology, we ensure customers can count on us to meet their needs.<p><br></p>Learn how we keep our customers rolling by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn, and by visiting progressrail.com .<p><br></p><strong>Key Job Elements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Responsible for designing and architecting complex embedded system;</li><li> Responsible for receiving specifications for new systems, and implementing them in code;</li><li> Responsible for analyzing system requirements and provide architectural decisions for the software engineering team;</li><li> Responsible for selecting project protocols and interfaces to support the requirements and design;</li><li> Must be able to lead a small team of engineers to investigate and author software designs as well as working directly on the software;</li><li> Test coded software requirements at desk and in lab;</li><li> Provide support to field personnel as required based on field problems related to areas of responsibility;</li><li> Knowledge of software engineering best practices and quality engineering processes is required;</li><li> Domestic and/or International travel of 2-4 weeks per year is typical with this position;</li><li> Candidate is expected to be a self-starter and able to multitask;</li><li> Ensure that all work assigned work is completed on time.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education / Training</strong><p><br></p>Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> BSEE or BSCS.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred:<p><br></p><ul><li> MSEE/MSCS;</li><li> 3.5 GPA or higher.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications And Experience</strong><p><br></p>Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> Minimum 5+ years experience with Embedded Programming in C;</li><li> Minimum 5+ years of experience designing/architecting complex software systems;</li><li> Excellent understanding of Software Configuration Management principles and processes;</li><li> Experience with networking protocols, preferably TCP/IP and/or CAN;</li><li> Experienced user of software version control programs and configuration management preferably GIT/Stash, Jira and Polarion/DOORS;</li><li> Excellent written and oral communication;</li><li> Experience with low level hardware, driver, software interactions for CAN communication;</li><li> High level of analytical ability.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred:<p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with QNX operating systems (highly preferred);</li><li> Experience with Matlab.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Progress Rail offers an excellent total compensation package,* including competitive salary, paid time off for vacation and holidays, 401(k) plan with company match, medical/dental/vision/life/disability insurance and flexible spending accounts. Relocation assistance may be available for some positions.<p><br></p><ul><li>Benefits eligibility differs by job position and employment status - governing plan documents control such benefits. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>EEO</strong><p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer – Race/Color/Sex/Religion/National Origin/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Vets/Disabilities<p><br></p><strong>Job Category</strong><p><br></p>Engineering<p><br></p><strong>PRS Facility Location</strong><p><br></p>EMD HQ LaGrange, IL- 400

title: Software Development Engineer
description: <strong>Requires Secret Clearance<br><br></strong>Designs, develops, troubleshoots, and analyzes computer software. Reviews architecture and selects and integrates appropriate development and support tools to ensure product performance. Investigates, identifies, and resolves code issues logged internally by QA or end users. Develops and maintains documentation.<br><br><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Works with user groups to solve business problems with available technology including hardware, software, databases, and peripherals.</li><li> Develops and implements processes that enable agile teaming to maximize talent utilization across the customer organization.</li><li> In depth understanding of emerging IT technologies in order to create directorate level business processes</li><li> Partners with various stakeholder organization's to lead planning and business process improvement efforts.</li><li> Establishes needed processes, governance structures, performance metrics and reporting.</li><li> Applies expert functional knowledge and experience to significant business projects or processes.</li><li> Maintains expertise by in-depth involvement in the state-of-the-art research and technology development in the field.</li><li> Monitors and/or participates in industry user forums, working groups in area of expertise.</li><li> As needed, identifies the most qualified internal resources and/or contractor team to assist with tasks. Selects contractors, frames statements of work, and directs the work of the team to assure technical and financial milestones are met.</li><li> May lead a small team of capable technical staff members and advises/mentors developing technical staff, does not have direct management responsibility.</li><li> Coaches and mentors internal staff in associated technical areas of expertise.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in a related field; Master's Degree preferred<br><br>15+ years of experience in a technical field<br><br>Tech Stack/Tool Suite to be used include and which expertise is required<br><ul><li> React 16.11.0</li><li> Bootstrap 4.3.1</li><li> jQuery 1.12.4</li><li> Node.js 10.24.1</li><li> Yarn 1.22.5</li><li> Jest 24.9.0</li><li> Ruby 2.6.8</li><li> Rails 5.1.7</li><li> RubyGems 3.0.3.1</li><li> Rack version 2.2.3</li><li> Rspec 3.10</li><li> MySQL (Rails uses mysql2 gem v0.5.3 as adapter)</li><li> AWS commercial services - SQS, DynamoDB, SNS</li><li> REST APIs</li><li> Angular</li><li> Java</li><li> Python</li><li> Groovy</li><li> Vue v2.0</li><li> Vuetify v1.5</li><li> FeathersJS v6.1</li><li> Sequelize v5.21</li><li> Axios v0.18</li><li> Express.js v4.16</li><li> AWS RDS for PostgreSQL</li><li> AWS Simple Storage Service (S3)</li><li> Docker</li><li> AWS Lambda<br></li></ul><strong><u>Other Job Specific Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li> Process oriented, conceptually driven and possess the ability to think strategically and work collaboratively in a highly technical setting.</li><li> Demonstrated success in developing strategic goals and leading complex programs.</li><li> Experience with project development lifecycle and systems operations.</li><li> Proven ability to interact with customers, senior leadership and program managers in a highly matrixed environment.</li><li> Proven ability to develop and extend network of working level contacts to facilitate behind the scenes coordination.</li><li> Proven experience in designing, developing, and delivering executive level communication on organization transformation and business process changes. Ability to prepare presentations and to present information to senior managers. * Ability to work and apply creativity in a fast paced environment.</li><li> Utilize creative problem-solving and communication--oral and written--skills, emphasizing the abilities to articulate, explain, and deliver technical concepts and issues to non-technical business leadership.</li><li> Recognized in field of expertise as an expert.<br></li></ul><strong>Certifications/Licensures<br><br></strong>Industry leading certification for technical expertise preferred<br><br>#cjpost

title: Application Developer
description: Costco IT is responsible for the <strong>technical future of Costco Wholesale</strong>, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks <strong>seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”</strong>.<p><br></p>This is an environment <strong>unlike anything in the high-tech world </strong>and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.<p><br></p>Come join <strong>Costco Digital - part of the Costco Wholesale IT family</strong>. Costco Digital is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation digital retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees. We are embarking on a large digital transformation and need team members like you to help us grow to the next level.<p><br></p>Our Digital team is transforming how we deliver solutions and interact with our members across our Mobile, Commerce and Order Management platforms. We have a culture of improvement &amp; learning with a start up mentality and a customer centric approach for our Costco members and our employees. We are looking for talented individuals to join our team and pursue bold ideas and explore growth opportunities.<p><br></p>The Costco team is looking for a dedicated and highly skilled <strong>Full Stack Engineer </strong>with an emphasis on cloud microservices development. This API Full Stack Engineer will perform development work including debugging and optimization of .net and Java microservices, associated back-end data store (NoSQL and RDBMS), and integration with other Costco systems. The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to manage the completion of projects that involve digital API services in a highly distributed and reliable application. This position will require an individual to design, build, debug, optimize and implement solutions in a fast paced Agile environment participating and working closely with a highly motivated team serving millions of customers on a daily basis.<p><br></p>If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide<strong> <u>BEST companies “to work for”,</u></strong> simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p><strong> <u> ROLE </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Supports Systems Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability and security into the design framework.</li><li>Performs development, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application.</li><li>Increases proficiency and understanding of relational and non-relational databases, distributed application architectures, user interfaces and user experience, quality assurance, security concerns, and business value creation.</li><li>Adopts engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions.</li><li>Provides the team with the development strategy, solution recommendations, and estimates for a given product/application.</li><li>Participates in scrum ceremonies (sprint planning, retrospective, showcases/demos, stand-ups, backlog refinement, etc.).</li><li>Creates and executes unit tests which validate the code changes made to support the implementation of a user story.</li><li>Uses test driven development (TDD) practices to assist with the detection/recognition of software defects early in the development process.</li><li>Works with team members to move user stories from the development backlog into testing and provides clarification when needed.</li><li>Estimates, plans, and manages all implementation tasks and reports on development progress.</li><li>Designs, builds, debugs, optimizes and implements solutions in .NET, Java, NoSql, and RDBMS. The development of high quality, efficient and fault tolerant is an essential part of the position.</li><li>Delivers automation scripts and unit test automation under DevSecOps.</li><li>Works with and supports Systems Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability and security into the design framework.</li><li>Performs development, debugging, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application.</li><li>Uses APM/monitoring tools such as Dynatrace/Splunk and browser tools to perform request purepath/waterfall analysis to identify bottlenecks and suggest improvements.</li><li>Drives engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions.</li><li>Participates in development and documentation of department standards and best practices, and mentor junior engineers.</li><li>Provides the team with solution recommendations and estimates for a given product/application.</li><li>Identifies deficiencies within a product/application’s code base and identifies opportunities to improve overall code quality.</li><li>Demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging technologies to support the development of new solutions.</li><li>Collaborates with team members (e.g., Systems Architects, Systems Analysts) to define project specifications and release documentation for all phases of the product development cycle from product definition to design, through implementation.</li><li>Conducts peer code reviews for the software changes made by other engineers within a team.</li><li>Understands the full technology stack and underlying applications, services, and databases in order to ensure optimal performance.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 5 years’ experience in performing API microservices development using C# and/or Java.</li><li>Experience with developing and running applications in a public cloud environment (Azure preferred).</li><li>Hands-on working knowledge of a major relational database (DB2, SQL Server etc.) and/or NoSql.</li><li>Experience working in CI/CD, and designing and delivering DevSecOps automation for app deployment and testing.</li><li>Strong knowledge and experience working with Web Technologies using JavaScript, React.</li><li>Experience describing the solutions and generating the architecture (Logical, Physical) artifacts.</li><li>Ability to work with all levels of the development organization, including non-technical resources.</li><li>Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful.</li><li>Team player, good interpersonal, organizational and communication skills. Creative, likes challenges.</li><li>Must be extremely responsive, able to work under pressure in crisis with a strong sense of urgency.</li><li>Responsible, conscientious, organized, self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision.</li><li>Application development in Java, JavaScript, .Net, Ember, and C#.</li><li>Experience programming in major databases such as Microsoft SQL Server.</li><li>Must possess a strong understanding of the software development process.</li><li>Strong knowledge of object oriented concepts.</li><li>Strong knowledge and experience working with databases.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills and be able to communicate to both technical and Business audiences.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to execute against iteration plans and deliver assignments within scope, schedule, and budget.</li><li>Ability to work with all management levels.</li><li>Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to multitask and prioritize work effectively in a fast-paced working environment.</li><li>Must be detail-oriented and possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze potential future issues.</li><li>Able to support off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Distributed cache technologies such as Redis.</li><li>Event and pub/sub technologies like Azure Service Bus, IBM MQ, and Kafka.</li><li>Integrating with and consuming external SaaS services like LucidWorks.</li><li>Knowledge of software design patterns.</li><li>Proven practical experience operating in a high scale production environment.</li><li>Prior experience with performance analysis and optimization of web services and software.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cover Letter</li><li>Resume</li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Ranges</u></strong><p><br></p>Level 3 - $127,500 - $162,500<p><br></p>Level 4 - $152,500 - $182,500, Bonus and Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) eligible<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. description_json: Costco IT is responsible for the <strong>technical future of Costco Wholesale</strong>, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks <strong>seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”</strong>.<p><br></p>This is an environment <strong>unlike anything in the high-tech world </strong>and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.<p><br></p>Come join <strong>Costco Digital - part of the Costco Wholesale IT family</strong>. Costco Digital is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation digital retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees. We are embarking on a large digital transformation and need team members like you to help us grow to the next level.<p><br></p>Our Digital team is transforming how we deliver solutions and interact with our members across our Mobile, Commerce and Order Management platforms. We have a culture of improvement &amp; learning with a start up mentality and a customer centric approach for our Costco members and our employees. We are looking for talented individuals to join our team and pursue bold ideas and explore growth opportunities.<p><br></p>The Costco team is looking for a dedicated and highly skilled <strong>Full Stack Engineer </strong>with an emphasis on cloud microservices development. This API Full Stack Engineer will perform development work including debugging and optimization of .net and Java microservices, associated back-end data store (NoSQL and RDBMS), and integration with other Costco systems. The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to manage the completion of projects that involve digital API services in a highly distributed and reliable application. This position will require an individual to design, build, debug, optimize and implement solutions in a fast paced Agile environment participating and working closely with a highly motivated team serving millions of customers on a daily basis.<p><br></p>If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide<strong> <u>BEST companies “to work for”,</u></strong> simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p><strong> <u> ROLE </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Supports Systems Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability and security into the design framework.</li><li>Performs development, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application.</li><li>Increases proficiency and understanding of relational and non-relational databases, distributed application architectures, user interfaces and user experience, quality assurance, security concerns, and business value creation.</li><li>Adopts engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions.</li><li>Provides the team with the development strategy, solution recommendations, and estimates for a given product/application.</li><li>Participates in scrum ceremonies (sprint planning, retrospective, showcases/demos, stand-ups, backlog refinement, etc.).</li><li>Creates and executes unit tests which validate the code changes made to support the implementation of a user story.</li><li>Uses test driven development (TDD) practices to assist with the detection/recognition of software defects early in the development process.</li><li>Works with team members to move user stories from the development backlog into testing and provides clarification when needed.</li><li>Estimates, plans, and manages all implementation tasks and reports on development progress.</li><li>Designs, builds, debugs, optimizes and implements solutions in .NET, Java, NoSql, and RDBMS. The development of high quality, efficient and fault tolerant is an essential part of the position.</li><li>Delivers automation scripts and unit test automation under DevSecOps.</li><li>Works with and supports Systems Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability and security into the design framework.</li><li>Performs development, debugging, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application.</li><li>Uses APM/monitoring tools title: Java Engineer
description: Salary: $110k-$120k<p><br></p>Location: East Chicago, IN<p><br></p>*Hybrid role. Must live within 1 hr. distance for occasional in-office travel*<p><br></p>*This role is unable to provide sponsorship*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science or related field.</li><li>3-5 years of enterprise IT security engineering experience</li><li>Knowledge of security and control frameworks, such as ISO 17799, COBIT, and NIST CyberSecurity Framework.</li><li>Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP), CompTIA Security+, or GIAC Security Essentials Certification (GSEC) certification required or must be obtained within 2 years of hire.</li><li>Experience with ProofPoint, Cisco AMP, SpecOps and other industry standard security tools.</li><li>Experience with Palo Alto Firewalls</li><li>Advanced knowledge of Network Security, Endpoint Security, Server hardening, patching, and base-lining, Mobile device security, Data Loss Prevention, IDS/IPS, Log analysis</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cisco ISE or NAC experience</li><li>Scripting (Python, Perl, Powershell) knowledge</li><li>CISSP</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain and implement the cybersecurity infrastructure and program</li><li>Collaborate with other technical teams to respond to threats as well as on a daily basis to maintain the security posture of the environment.</li><li>Work on highly complex projects and maintains knowledge across multiple domains (networking, server, end points, mobile, cloud, etc.)</li><li>Involved in patching, maintaining Firewalls, scanning for vulnerabilities, keeping current on the latest security threats and trends, and reviewing technical architecture for security compliance</li></ul>

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer
description: <strong>Who We Are: It all starts with purpose.<br><br></strong>We are a purpose-driven nonprofit with a dynamic staff culture.<br><br>With a meaningful purpose, motivated staff, and excellent benefits, working here will definitely have you smiling! The ADA’s headquarters is located just steps from Chicago’s Magnificent Mile and close to public transportation. With more than 400 colleagues, the ADA Staff are some of the most talented people in the Chicago, Washington D.C., and Maryland area.<br><br>We were named a <strong>Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune </strong>in 2019 and 2021! <strong>Come join our team!<br><br></strong><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br><br></strong>The Application Program Interface (API) Developer will design, develop, and maintain web-based APIs and the associated services, databases, and applications. They will also be responsible for monitoring and optimizing the performance of the inventory of APIs and they will troubleshoot and debug API’s and the associated services, databases, and applications.<br><br><strong>Must-Have:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree (or 9 years experience in lieu of degree)</li><li>5+ years of experience with databases, data structures, security protocols, and authentication mechanisms</li><li>Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, JavaScript, C#, Python, etc. </li><li>Proficiency in .Net applications </li><li>Working knowledge of web services and RESTful APIs </li><li>Knowledge of web technologies such as HTML, CSS, AJAX, etc.</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot and debug problems and work independently and as part of a team</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and communication skills</li><li>Proficiency in Microsofts Office Suite, API databases (ex. Postman), CMS (ex: Sitecore, Sitefinity), Wordpress, Cloud based hosting (Azure, AWS), Google Analytics, Data from CRM (ex. Salesforce, Aptify), single page applications (Angular, React), Visual Studio, and associated next generation applications.</li><li>Occasional travel<br><br></li></ul><strong>Nice to Have:<br></strong><ul><li>Master’s degree.</li><li>Experience using program specification and structured development methodology, multiple content management systems, current web analytic tools, and data warehouse technologies. </li><li>Experience integrating Aptify Association Management System with Web based properties. </li><li>Solid understanding Object Oriented concepts, relational databases, Headless content delivery, and Bootstrap concepts</li><li>Experience using advanced search technologies like Coveo and Azure Search</li><li>Experience using AI or Machine Learning technologies and writing SQL queries </li><li>Knowledge of Metaverse <br><br></li></ul><strong>Just a few of the benefits offered to employees:<br></strong><ul><li>Promotes Work/Life Balance</li><li>Hybrid Work Schedule (2-3 days from home)</li><li>Health insurance/ dental reimbursement plan</li><li>Ample Paid time off</li><li>401(k) </li><li>Pension</li><li>Flexible Spending Account</li><li>Life insurance</li><li>Tuition reimbursement</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Pet Insurance</li><li>Student Loan Refinance</li><li>2 days off to work at a charity event of your choice<br><br></li></ul>The American Dental Association is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. The American Dental Association is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at recruiting@ada.org.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Salesforce, Aptify), single page applications (Angular, React), Visual Studio, and associated next generation applications.</li><li>Occasional travel<br><br></li></ul><strong>Nice to Have:<br></strong><ul><li>Master’s degree.</li><li>Experience using program specification and structured development methodology, multiple content management systems, current web analytic tools, and data warehouse technologies. </li><li>Experience integrating Aptify Association Management System with Web based properties. </li><li>Solid understanding Object Oriented concepts, relational databases, Headless content delivery, and Bootstrap concepts</li><li>Experience using advanced search technologies like Coveo and Azure Search</li><li>Experience using AI or Machine Learning technologies and writing SQL queries </li><li>Knowledge of Metaverse <br><br></li></ul><strong>Just a few of the benefits offered to employees:<br></strong><ul><li>Promotes Work/Life Balance</li><li>Hybrid Work Schedule (2-3 days from home)</li><li>Health insurance/ dental reimbursement plan</li><li>Ample Paid time off</li><li>401(k) </li><li>Pension</li><li>Flexible Spending Account</li><li>Life insurance</li><li>Tuition reimbursement</li><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Pet Insurance</li><li>Student Loan Refinance</li><li>2 days off to work at a charity event of your choice<br><br></li></ul>The American Dental Association is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. W2<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br></u></strong><ul><li> Responsible for coordinating data needs across all value streams and provide insight and support into data enhancements and data improvements as identified by gap analyses.</li><li> The roles will require thought leadership and, at time, solution architecture skills, as well as various technical experience including data generation, data scrubbing, data provisioning, data obfuscation, and solutioning and designing of data architecture and engineering enhancements in distributed environments.</li><li> Assist in data access, evaluation, and optimization throughout the Client organization. Ability to build data masking configurations in the data masking tools.</li><li> Provide mentoring to Test Data Analysts as needed</li></ul>

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <strong>Title: C# .Net developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Oakbrook IL<p><br></p><strong>Overview:</strong><p><br></p>Sterling has helped build careers for thousands for professionals like yourself. Our expert recruiters support you at every step in the process and as a Best of Staffing company, Sterling provides exciting work with exceptional employers across the U.S.<p><br></p><strong>Hire Type:</strong> Direct Hire<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Looking for strong C# .Net skills. This role is responsible for developing and maintaining development platforms. This includes, but is not limited to middleware that serves as the foundation platforms.<p><br></p><strong>This is hybrid position with expectation to be on site 3 days a week (Monday, Wednesday and 3rd day of choice)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Work using Agile methodologies such as Scrum to develop middleware</li><li> Analyze requirements, collaborate with architects and senior engineers to produce thoughtful software designs of moderate scope and complexity</li><li> Participate in peer reviews and pull requests to yield high quality software</li><li> Present software concepts, designs, or code in a design review forum</li><li> Provide mentoring and coaching to junior engineers to increase the software development capability of the middleware team. description: Salary: Starting at $180k + bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p>*We are unable to provide sponsorship for this role*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B.S. in Computer Science or (preferred) M.S. in Computer Science or Information Systems</li><li>Minimum 10+ years of experience in Compute (Linux/Windows) administration</li><li>Minimum 5 years leading projects</li><li>Experience in a regulated/financial industry</li><li>Experience in Linux and Windows OS</li><li>Experience with VMWARE</li><li>Experience with EMC and Netapp Storage</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python</li><li>Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - (WASM or Server Side)<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Implement specified design while developing greater facility with advanced design concepts and patterns</li><li>Supports the title: .Net Software Engineer - Remote | WFH
description: <strong>Job#: 1330430</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>API Developer </strong></u><p><br></p><strong>Job Description: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is on the API Management team within Digital. The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring.</li><li>Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work.</li><li>Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls.</li><li>Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems.</li><li>Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features</li><li>Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits 6. Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team</li><li>Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment.</li><li>Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness.</li><li>Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Typical Day</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge, OAS Spec review, Proxy development. Hybrid work, need to be at located at commutable distance from Chicago. There will be an in person interview.</li><li>Will be working with team members across the world virtually. Will also be interacting with team members in the Chicago office twice a week.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education/Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Position requires a four-year degree from an accredited college or university. 2. 2+ years or more of software development experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills Required</strong>:<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge, AWS API Gateway or Azure API Gateway or similar.</li><li>Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral.</li><li>Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS.</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity working in a Scrum environment</li><li>Must demonstrate solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.</li><li>Hands on experience with metrics and visualization tools like Kibana, Grafana, or equivalent.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Soft Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal skills</li><li>Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints.</li><li>Passion for technology and an eagerness to contribute to a team-oriented environment.</li><li>Must be reliable and proactive – able to work independently and meet deadlines.</li></ul><p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: .NET Developer with Blazor (WASM or Server Side)
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Payload and Ground Systems Division of the Northrop Grumman Space Systems is seeking an experienced Test Automation Software Engineer to be responsible for design, development, and maintenance of various test automation tools for our space payload products.<br><br>Responsibilities for a Test Automation Engineer include test software development and deployment, testing and troubleshooting of the test environment, reading error logs, and coordinate corrective actions with the product development team. Additional responsibilities may include an understanding of test plans, test procedures, test automation, test reports, and execution of integration test activities in System Integration Labs (SILs) or offsite locations.<br><br>Some examples of test software that you will be designing include factory test scripts for individual RF and digital circuit cards, design verification test (DVT) scripts for individual cards and integrated payloads, peripheral component emulators and simulators, data processing and visualization scripts.<br><br>We are interested in highly motivated candidates that enjoy working independently in a fast-paced engineering lab environment.<br><br>This requisition may be filled at a higher job grade based on the qualifications listed below.<br><br><strong> The position requires candidates to be able to obtain and maintain DoD Top Secret/SCI security clearance which requires United States Citizenship. <br><br></strong><strong>Up to $15k sign on bonus for qualified candidates ($10k for Active/Current TS/SCI with additional $5k for poly)<br><br></strong><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>For Principal Level: Bachelor's Degree and minimum of 5 years of relevant professional work experience OR Master's degree and minimum of 3 years of relevant experience</li><li>For Sr. Principal Level: Bachelor's Degree and minimum of 9 years of relevant professional work experience OR Master's degree and minimum of 7 years of relevant experience</li><li>Extensive experience developing test automation scripts in Python</li><li>Experience developing test scripts to interface with RF test equipment</li><li>Working knowledge of Robot Framework</li><li>Working knowledge of source control tools</li><li>Experience developing in a hybrid Linux/Windows environment</li><li>Ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret security clearance with SCI, which requires U.S. Citizenship</li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Active or Current Top Secret clearance with SCI</li><li>Developing of test GUIs in Python or C++</li><li>Working knowledge of C/C++</li><li>Experience developing design verification tests for RF systems based on system requirements</li><li>Experience analyzing test data and generating system test reports</li><li>Working knowledge of requirements management tools (DOORs, Jama, etc)</li><li>Working knowledge of Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $90,600 USD - $136,000 USD<br><br><strong>Salary Range 2: </strong> $112,300 USD - $168,500 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: C# Risk Modeling Developer
description: Rate: Open<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><ul><li>Candidates must apply directly to this job post for consideration*</li><li>Third Party Agency calls/emails will be denied*</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Java 8+ experience required, including deep understanding of Java fundamentals as Memory Model, Runtime Environment, Concurrency and Multithreading.</li><li>Experience with Kafka</li><li>Java persistence layers and SQLs</li><li>Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc.</li><li>Deep knowledge of RESTful standards and practice.</li><li>Experience in computer algorithms and data structures, including ability to articulate and apply in practice different type of sorting, hashing, partitioning, and search operations.</li><li>Ability to identify both time and memory complexity for the written code.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Primarily responsibility is application development following API driven micro-services and micro-applications architecture for given business requirements adhering agile SDLC.</li><li>Analyzes requirements, develops, tests, and documents software quality to ensure proper implementation.</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet: both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is properly represented.</li><li>Application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements.</li><li>Providing advice on system functionality and fixes as required</li></ul>

title: C# or C++ Developer - Contract
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>About The Role:</strong><p><br></p>The ideal candidate enjoys working with C++ and server side technologies and thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. This individual will be a part of the Core Server development team and will be responsible for developing and sustaining high performance, multi-tiered, scalable applications. The candidate will enhance existing applications and offer suggestions to improve the architecture and better ways of building and maintaining applications. We are seeking a Market Data Developer, with experience in parsing market data from equities, options or futures exchanges.<p><br></p><strong><u>What Youll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Plan, design and develop high quality C++ server side applications with real-time trading market data.</li><li>Implement solutions using the latest features of C++11, C++14, C++17.</li><li>Propose and deliver scalability and performance improvements to our existing applications.</li><li>Work with developers and traders to receive feedback and articulate ideas for improvements.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>What Were Looking For:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years of experience with C++ on Linux</li><li>Experience designing, developing, and supporting server side applications for market data processing, trading, risk management, and monitoring applications.</li><li>Linux, Multithreading</li><li>Working knowledge of shared memory, sockets programming including TCP and UDP</li><li>Working knowledge of object oriented programming, SOLID design principles, and design patterns</li><li>Good to have deep knowledge of latency measurement and latency optimization</li><li>Good to have experience with SQL, Thread pools, messaging systems</li><li>Stay abreast of advances in technology</li><li>Major in an engineering or technical field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Why Is This a Great Opportunity</u></strong><p><br></p>Small prop trading firm (40 people) and growing.Very team oriented and friendly work culture. title: APIGEE Developer
description: Allgemeine Informationen<p><br></p>Akkodis – entstanden durch den Zusammenschluss von AKKA &amp; Modis – ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Engineering &amp; IT. Als globaler Partner in einer sich ständig verändernden Technologie- &amp; Wettbewerbsumgebung unterstützen wir unsere Kunden mit unserem 360°-Angebot dabei, eine nachhaltigere &amp; smartere Zukunft zu gestalten. Vereint durch unsere gemeinsame Leidenschaft für Technologie &amp; Talente betrachten wir die Welt aus einem neuen Blickwinkel. Unsere 50.000 motivierten Ingenieur:innen &amp; Digitalexpert:innen gehen dabei täglich über das Mögliche hinaus, um Unglaubliches zu schaffen.<p><br></p>IT Security Engineer (m/w/d)<p><br></p>Bremen oder Kiel oder Wilhelmshaven / Ref-Nr.: 2022-24474<p><br></p>Deine Aufgaben<p><br></p><ul><li>Verantwortung für die spezifischen Systeme der Disziplin Security entlang des Produktlebenszyklus</li><li>Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem IT Security Consultant unter Beachtung des BSI Grundschutzes</li><li>Koordination der regelmäßigen Durchführung von Penetrationstests und Sicherstellung, dass identifizierte Risiken und Schwachstellen umgehend behandelt werden</li><li>Vollumfängliche Neueinführung von Soft- und Hardwarelösungen, Erstellung von virtualisierten Cluster-Serversystemen und Härten der Firewalls</li><li>Kompetenter Ansprechpartner für die sichere Konfiguration von IT-Systemen und die Umsetzung sicherheitsrelevanter Anforderungen in der Software Entwicklung</li></ul><p><br></p>Dein Profil<p><br></p><ul><li>Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung sowie fundierte Berufserfahrung</li><li>Gute Kenntnisse von Betriebssystemen (z.B. Microsoft, Linux/Ubuntu, Windows Client)</li><li>Erfahrung mit Virtualisierungslösungen wie Hyper-V, VMWARE ESXi und Cisco Firewalls wünschenswert</li><li>Selbstständige Arbeitsweise, Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Durchsetzungsfähigkeit</li><li>Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift</li></ul><p><br></p>Bei uns erhältst Du die Möglichkeit einer spannenden Karriere mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum in einem hoch innovativen und technologischen Umfeld. Werde Teil unseres weltweiten Netzwerks von Expert:innen und motivierten Teams. Dein/e Karriere-Ansprechpartner/in Robin DERICHS steht Dir gerne für Fragen zur Verfügung und freut sich auf Deine Bewerbung über unser Online-Formular.

description: Allgemeine Informationen<p><br></p>Akkodis – entstanden durch den Zusammenschluss von AKKA &amp; Modis – ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Engineering &amp; IT. Als globaler Partner in einer sich ständig verändernden Technologie- &amp; Wettbewerbsumgebung unterstützen wir unsere Kunden mit unserem 360°-Angebot dabei, eine nachhaltigere &amp; smartere Zukunft zu gestalten. Unsere 50.000 motivierten Ingenieur:innen &amp; Digitalexpert:innen gehen dabei täglich über das Mögliche hinaus, um Unglaubliches zu schaffen.<p><br></p>Requirements Engineer Einsatzsysteme Marine (m/w/d)<p><br></p>Bremen oder Kiel oder Wilhelmshaven / Ref-Nr.: 2022-21658<p><br></p>Deine Aufgaben<p><br></p><ul><li>Definition der Funktionsweise der Einsatzsysteme auf Schiffen z.B. Führungs- und Waffensysteme, Kommunikationssysteme oder Radar</li><li>Anforderungsanalyse und Erstellung von Mengengerüsten und Terminplänen</li><li>Technisches Management inkl. Auswahl entsprechender Untersysteme und Bewertung von Leistungsfähigkeit und Kosten</li><li>Koordination und Steuerung der Unterauftragnehmer sowie inner- und außerbetrieblicher Schnittstellen von Systemkomponenten</li><li>Übernahme der technischen Absprache mit Stakeholdern und Untersystemen</li></ul><p><br></p>Dein Profil<p><br></p><ul><li>Abgeschlossenes technisches Studium im Bereich Nachrichtentechnik, System Engineering, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbar</li><li>Fundierte Berufserfahrung im Systems Engineering bestenfalls im Marineumfeld</li><li>Erfahrung in der Planung, Spezifikation, Durchführung und Berichterstattung von Führungs- und Combat Systemen wünschenswert</li><li>Sicherer Umgang mit der Anforderungsmanagement-Software DOORS</li></ul><p><br></p>Bei uns erhältst Du die Möglichkeit einer spannenden Karriere mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum in einem hoch innovativen und technologischen Umfeld. title: Contract - Java Developer (Streaming)
description: <strong>Venture-backed blockchain infrastructure startup is hiring for a Remote Senior Rust Engineer!</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by: Sydney Weaver<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary: $150,000 - $500,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A bit about us:</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Rust Engineer to join our fast-growing LL2 crypto infrastructure startup. As a Senior Rust Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our core systems and infrastructure using the Rust programming language. Join our dynamic and innovative team, and be part of shaping the future of LL2 crypto infrastructure. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and a stimulating work environment where your expertise will be highly valued and your ideas can make a significant impact!<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Design, build, and maintain our blockchain infrastructure using Rust</li><li> Work closely with our team of developers to ensure the smooth operation of our blockchain platform</li><li> Develop and implement security protocols to protect our blockchain infrastructure</li><li> Monitor and troubleshoot any issues that arise with our blockchain platform</li><li> Collaborate with other teams to integrate our blockchain platform with other systems</li><li> Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in blockchain technology and make recommendations for new features and improvements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Great health benefits package, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match</li><li> Remote work (local to USA)</li><li> Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity </li><li> Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity. </li><li> Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company's product and as well as the industry at large.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a talented and experienced Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer to join our Engineering team. As a Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our blockchain infrastructure. You will work closely with our team of developers to ensure the smooth operation of our blockchain platform. This is a permanent position in a dynamic and exciting startup environment.<p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li> 2 + years of experience at a crypto native startup, preferably blockchain infrastructure</li><li> Strong experience with Rust programming language</li><li> Experience working with crypto native startup</li><li> Deep understanding of blockchain technology and protocols</li><li> Experience with blockchain security protocols and best practices</li><li> Knowledge of distributed systems and networking</li><li> Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li><li> Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li> Strong communication and collaboration skills</li></ul><p><br></p>If you are passionate about blockchain technology and have a proven track record of building and maintaining blockchain infrastructure, we want to hear from you. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing startup and make a significant impact on the future of blockchain technology.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: C++ Serverside Developer
description: "ALL our jobs are US based and candidates must be in the US with valid US Work Authorization. Please apply on our website directly." CyberArk AAM/Conjur engineer Contract-6 Months+ Chicago/IL OR Richardson,TX Rate::$70/hr on C2C All inclusive<p><br></p>This position is part of the Security Design team, which encompasses secrets management through AAM and Conjur, privileged access engineering through CyberArk, and new identity orchestration and automation capabilities.<p><br></p>5+ years of combined experience as a Security Engineer. echnical experience with a Privileged Identity Management solution such as CyberArk. Will be tasked with helping integrate applications across the landscape to leverage CyberArk's AAM suite and Conjur (DAP) which focuses on eliminating hard coded credentials stored in application source code. This involves consulting with application development teams and assisting with refactoring source code to leverage RESTful API integrations which call back to the enterprise password vault. CyberArk AAM components include the agent-less Central Credential Prover, agent-based Credential Providers for OS systems and agent-less Conjur Dynamic Access Provider for server-less applications. Must be proficient in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and related frameworks (e.g., Node.js, React, Angular Familiarity with DevOps CI/CD tools, such as Ansible, Puppet, Jenkins and Terraform. Experience integrating RESTful APIs across multiple technologies and applications using custom scripted processes. Must be able to support technical server level administration for Windows and RHEL operating systems. Experience using Postman or other API testing software for web service calls. Must be knowledgeable with source code management tools such as Bitbucket and GitHub. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment and interface with stakeholders at various levels.
